ProgramName: Master of Education in School Counseling
Description: The Professional Counseling Program at MTSU offers two M.Ed. programs: Clinical Mental Health Counseling and School Counseling. Both programs are CACREP-accredited and designed to prepare students for licensure as professional counselors in the state of Tennessee and for national certification. Our mission is to prepare competent, ethically and culturally-aware counselors to work in a variety of settings. We are committed to an inclusive learning environment and value the importance of diversity and advocacy. We seek to foster a professional identity in our students as counselors who will be leaders, advocates and life-long learners. Faculty in the professional counseling program provide a challenging, yet supportive, student-centered environment. In addition to rigorous coursework and an emphasis on professional identity development, students are provided extensive opportunities for clinical skill development, professional development, research, and service. The School Counseling program prepares students to work as school counselors in K-12 school settings.
Accredidation: CACREP-accredited

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Liberal Arts
Description: The Master of Arts in Liberal Arts (M.A.L.A.) degree is an individually designed, interdisciplinary program of study for students whose educational goals are not met by traditional graduate programs. M.A.L.A. students create their own programs of study by drawing on the course offerings of various departments in the College of Liberal Arts and, when appropriate, on the offerings of other colleges of the university. The program is designed for students who desire a broader-based, more flexible curriculum than is available in a traditional master's degree program. It can be especially useful for those whose career or personal interests are interdisciplinary in nature. The program requires 30 semester hours of course work in at least two, but no more than three, fields of study. Students will also be required to complete a thesis (6 semester hours) or a creative project (3 semester hours) in which they will demonstrate their ability to work in an interdisciplinary manner.

ProgramName: Master of Business Administration in Concrete Industry Management
Description: The Concrete Industry Management (CIM) M.B.A. is a specialized business degree that is designed to broaden the graduate's knowledge of business and management in general and the concrete industry in particular. Courses are delivered on-campus and synchronously online, providing both face-to-face and virtual interaction with faculty and fellow students. Offered through the Jennings A. Jones College of Business, which is accredited by AACSB International, the CIM M.B.A. is a 30-credit hour program requiring a four-year bachelor's degree. Students from various undergraduate backgrounds are considered.
Accredidation: Offered through the Jennings A. Jones College of Business, which is accredited by AACSB International

ProgramName: Master of Science in Health Care Informatics
Description: The Master of Science in Health Care Informatics is designed to prepare students for informatics leadership roles in a variety of health care settings. The curriculum is comprised of 33-credit hours that provides students with knowledge and skills in information systems, health care systems, and leadership. The curriculum has a strong emphasis on project management, systems analysis and design, and decision support. The program is offered completely online, making it attractive to working professionals. Graduates of the program are able to plan, design, implement, and direct health care information systems in a variety of settings. Students will learn the essentials of health care information technology, data analytics and research, legal and ethical issues, leadership and management, clinical decision support, and project management. Coursework is designed to promote critical thinking and problem-solving skills to manage health information and the systems that store, transmit, and analyze that information.
MinimumGreScore: 146 on the Verbal portion and 144 on the Quantitative portion

ProgramName: Master of Arts in International Affairs
Concentration: International Development and Humanitarian Assistance, International Security and Peace Studies
Description: The Master of Arts in International Affairs (M.A.I.A.) is an interdisciplinary program designed for students who desire careers in the public, private, or non-profit sectors with an international orientation. Graduates find jobs as foreign service officers, intelligence analysts, military officers, international civil servants, political risk analysts, international business consultants, policy advocates for non-governmental organizations, and international bankers, among many others. The curriculum blends academic study with policy analysis to equip students with practical knowledge and marketable skills. Students are encouraged to study foreign languages and travel or study abroad during their program. A capstone experience can take the form of an academic thesis or an applied professional project. The M.A.I.A. offers a general track in International Affairs, or one of two specialized concentrations in International Development and Humanitarian Assistance, or in International Security and Peace Studies.

ProgramName: Master of Arts in International Security and Peace
Description: The Master of Arts in International Affairs (MAIA) is a two-year, 36-credit interdisciplinary program designed to prepare students for professional and academic careers in the increasingly complex and interconnected world of international affairs. The MAIA program equips students with the essential knowledge, research skills, and practical tools to understand, analyze, and address the multifaceted political, historical, economic, social, and cultural issues that shape our world. Students in the MAIA program will: Learn to critically examine international issues from a variety of disciplinary perspectives, including political science, history, economics, sociology, and cultural studies. Develop strong analytical and research skills through rigorous coursework, culminating in a thesis or a comprehensive exam project. Gain practical experience through internships, study abroad programs, and other experiential learning opportunities. Engage with faculty who are experts in their fields and are committed to mentoring students. Benefit from a small, diverse, and collaborative learning environment.
ScholarshipAmount: Up to $10,000 stipend plus a full tuition waiver

ProgramName: Master of Arts in International Development and Globalization
Description: The Master of Arts degree in International Affairs is designed to meet the academic and professional needs of students interested in all facets of the international arena. It is an interdisciplinary program that draws upon faculty from seven different departments. The program requires 36 hours of course work that includes an interdisciplinary core of 9 hours. Students may choose to specialize in one of two concentrations: International Security and Peace Studies or International Development and Globalization. All students also choose a regional specialization to further deepen their understanding of global politics and cultures. Students in the program may take advantage of the many study abroad opportunities offered by MTSU, and the program encourages students to pursue internships in the public or private sectors. Students complete their degrees by either writing a master's thesis or sitting for a comprehensive exam.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Actuarial Science
Description:
An actuary is a business professional who uses mathematical and statistical skills to manage financial risks. Actuaries are in high demand and enjoy a top-ranked profession with excellent salaries and a high level of job satisfaction. For more information, please see BeAnActuary.org.

The M.S. in Actuarial Science program at MTSU offers a balance of theory and application with substantial exposure to the real-world usage of actuarial concepts. Students will be well prepared to pass the preliminary professional examinations administered by the major actuarial professional societies in the United States: the Society of Actuaries (SOA) and the Casualty Actuarial Society (CAS). The program is designed to develop the students' ability to apply mathematical concepts and analytical skills to solve business problems and manage financial risks in insurance companies, consulting firms, government, and in many other capacities.
Accredidation: The M.S. in Actuarial Science program at MTSU has received the distinction of being designated a Center of Actuarial Excellence (CAE) by the Society of Actuaries (SOA), the largest professional organization for actuaries in the world.

ProgramName: Doctor of Education in Assessment, Learning, and Student Success
Description: MTSU's Doctor of Education, or Ed.D., in Assessment, Learning, and Student Success program is designed for those working in K-12 and higher education who are interested in improving teaching and student learning. The program focuses on three major areas: assessment, learning, and student success. It has a focus on improvement science, an approach to problem-solving. Students identify a problem of practice in their context, their school or school district, try to make a change that they think will be an improvement and then study it in very rapid cycles. Graduates of this program are qualified to work as assessment specialists in school districts, universities, and other government agencies or private companies; direct student success initiatives at colleges and universities; teach in higher education institutions; or become curriculum specialists in school districts.
ScholarshipType: Graduate Assistantships, MTSU Graduate Scholarship, Dissertation Scholarships

Description: The Master of Arts in Economics is designed to prepare students for careers as professional economists in business and government. It is also an excellent preparation for students who wish to pursue a Ph.D. in economics. The program is small, allowing for close student-faculty interaction. The program may be completed on a full-time (three courses per semester) or part-time basis. Full-time students typically finish the program in three to four semesters. Many of the courses are offered in the late afternoons and evenings to accommodate working students.
Accredidation: The Jennings A. Jones College of Business is accredited by AACSB International-the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business-the premier accrediting agency for business schools.

Description: The Master of Science in Geosciences offers a curriculum designed to be relevant to today's employment trends and needs in the geosciences including environmental geoscience and geoarchaeology. The department is housed in the Davis Science Building, which includes facilities for remote sensing, GIS, geoarchaeology, paleontology, mineralogy, petrology, environmental chemistry, and hydrogeology. There are several active student organizations, including the student chapters of the American Association of Petroleum Geologists, the Association of Environmental & Engineering Geologists, and the National Speleological Society. The Department of Geosciences offers two options for the M.S. degree. A thesis option is available for students wishing to pursue research with a faculty member as part of the degree program. This is the more common degree option chosen by students who plan to enter a doctoral program or seek professional employment as a geologist. The non-thesis option provides a curriculum designed for students who are pursuing a career in geoscience education or for those students who are already established in their career and wish to further their education. Each student works closely with a graduate advisor who helps design an individualized curriculum based on the student's career objectives.
ScholarshipAmount: Minimum stipend of $10,000 for fall/spring plus a tuition waiver

Description: The Master of Arts in History at MTSU is a 30-hour program offering both thesis and non-thesis options. The program requires three core courses: HIST 6010 (Historiography), HIST 6020 (Historical Research and Writing), and one course in digital history. It then provides specialized training in either U.S. history or world history (including Europe). A concentration in Public History is also available. The program is designed to be completed in four full-time semesters. Students can complete the M.A. either on campus or through our fully online program. MTSU's M.A. in History is designed to meet the needs of a wide range of students, including those who plan to pursue a Ph.D. in history; those who plan to teach in community colleges, junior colleges, or secondary schools; those who are already teachers and want to improve their skills and earn a graduate degree; and those who want to enter the field of public history (archives, historic preservation, historical archaeology, and museums).

MTSU's graduate programs in public history prepare students for careers in museums, historic preservation, archives and records management, oral history, cultural resource management, and other related fields. Our M.A. program in history with a concentration in public history is one of the oldest and largest in the country, and our Ph.D. in Public History is the only one of its kind in the world. As of Fall 2017, the M.A. concentration is available entirely via distance education. More than 450 of our alumni are working in public history fields around the world.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Professional Science
Concentration: Actuarial Sciences, Biostatistics, Biotechnology, Engineering Management, Geosciences, Health Care Informatics, Supply Chain Management
Description: The Professional Science Master's (P.S.M.) is an innovative graduate degree designed to allow students to pursue advanced training in science or mathematics, while simultaneously developing workplace skills highly valued by employers. P.S.M. programs consist of two years of academic training in an emerging or interdisciplinary area, along with a professional component that may include internships and "cross-training" in workplace skills, such as business, communications, and regulatory affairs. All are designed in concert with employers and are designed to dovetail into present and future professional career opportunities.
Accredidation: Certified by the Commission on Affiliation of PSM programs.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Professional Science - Actuarial Sciences
Description: The Master of Science in Professional Science is an innovative graduate degree designed to allow students to pursue advanced training in a science or mathematics discipline while simultaneously developing highly valued business, communication, and regulatory skills. This interdisciplinary program prepares graduates for careers in business, industry, government, and the nonprofit sector where workforce needs are rapidly changing. Degree programs consist of a core of business and communication courses and a set of science or mathematics courses within a chosen concentration.

ProgramName: Master of Science Professional Science - Biotechnology
Description:
The Master of Science in Professional Science is an innovative master's degree program designed for students who wish to pursue advanced training in a science discipline and at the same time develop highly-valued business skills. The M.S.P.S. is a two-year program that combines a core curriculum of business and management courses with a student's chosen science concentration. Graduates are prepared for careers in business, government, or non-profit sectors where scientific expertise and business fundamentals are needed.
Biotechnology is the use of living systems and organisms to develop or make useful products, or 'any technological application that uses biological systems, living organisms or derivatives thereof, to make or modify products or processes for specific use' (UN Convention on Biological Diversity). Depending on the tools and applications, it often overlaps with the (related) fields of molecular biology, bio-engineering, biomedical engineering, biomanufacturing, molecular engineering, etc. For many centuries, humankind has used biotechnology in agriculture, food production, and medicine. The term is largely believed to have been coined in 1919 by Hungarian engineer Károly Ereky. In the late 20th and early 21st century, biotechnology has expanded to include new and diverse sciences such as genomics, recombinant gene techniques, applied immunology, and development of pharmaceutical therapies and diagnostic tests. A minor in Business is recommended for this concentration.
MinimumGreScore: 146 on the verbal portion and 144 on the quantitative portion

ProgramName: Master of Science Professional Science - Engineering Management
Description: The Engineering Management concentration is one of six concentrations in the Master of Science in Professional Science (M.S.P.S.) degree program. This interdisciplinary program is designed for individuals with science, technology, engineering, or mathematics (STEM) backgrounds who wish to pursue management roles in their fields. The program combines advanced coursework from the College of Basic and Applied Sciences with graduate business and management coursework from the Jones College of Business. Students in the Engineering Management concentration complete a common core of business and management courses and a concentration core of engineering technology courses. The program is designed to provide graduates with the management skills needed to be effective leaders in technical organizations. This program is available both on-campus and fully online.

Concentration: Clinical, Experimental, Industrial-Organizational, Quantitative, Pre-Specialist in School Psychology
Description: The Master of Arts in Psychology program offers concentrations in Clinical, Experimental, Industrial-Organizational, Quantitative, and Pre-Specialist in School Psychology. The Clinical, Experimental, and I-O Psychology concentrations prepare students for doctoral study in these respective areas or for entry into master's-level careers. Students in the Quantitative Psychology concentration take a number of statistics and measurement courses to prepare for doctoral programs in quantitative psychology, educational measurement, and related fields or for careers in a variety of settings such as testing companies or research organizations. The School Psychology concentration prepares students for entry into the Specialist in Education (Ed.S.) program in School Psychology at MTSU, as completion of the Ed.S. is required for licensure as a school psychologist. All concentrations require a common core of courses as well as courses in the student's area of interest.

The Master of Arts in Psychology is a versatile degree. The Quantitative Psychology concentration prepares students for doctoral programs in psychology or for careers in which research and data analytic skills are central. The program provides strong training in research methodology, statistics, and measurement, with a variety of basic and applied psychology courses.

The Industrial/Organizational (I/O) Psychology master's program at MTSU is dedicated to the scientific study of human behavior in work settings. The program follows a scientist-practitioner model, which emphasizes the connection of science and practice. Students in the program can expect to learn about the major areas of I/O psychology: personnel psychology (e.g., selection, performance appraisal, and training), organizational psychology (e.g., motivation, leadership, and work attitudes), and health and safety in the workplace. Students learn through a combination of coursework and hands-on experience by completing an internship and a thesis. Upon completing the program, students can pursue positions in a variety of industries (e.g., consulting, manufacturing, healthcare, and government), as well as continue their education in doctoral programs. For students interested in a doctoral degree, our program has an excellent placement rate in I/O psychology doctoral programs. The Society for Industrial and Organizational Psychology (SIOP) publishes guidelines for master's-level training in I/O psychology. The M.A. in I/O Psychology program at MTSU follows the SIOP guidelines. The I/O psychology M.A. program is a member of the Council for Applied Master's Programs in Psychology (CAMPP).
Accredidation: The M.A. in I/O Psychology program at MTSU follows the SIOP guidelines. The I/O psychology M.A. program is a member of the Council for Applied Master's Programs in Psychology (CAMPP).
MinimumGreScore: target minimum scores of 147 verbal, 147 quantitative, and 4.0 analytic writing
ScholarshipAmount: The minimum stipend for a full-time (20 hours/week) master's graduate assistant is $8,000 for the academic year.

ProgramName: Doctor of Philosophy in Public History
Concentration: Historic Preservation/Cultural Resource Management, Museum Management
Description: The Public History Ph.D. program at MTSU offers students the opportunity to earn a doctoral degree in a field that has seen tremendous growth in recent decades. The program offers a broad exposure to the historical sub-disciplines necessary to be a successful public historian in the 21st century. It is the first doctoral program in the field in Tennessee and is unique in its breadth and focus. The program also draws on the Center for Historic Preservation, the Albert Gore Research Center, and the work of our nationally recognized faculty in public history, historic preservation, and American history. MTSU has one of the largest public history and historic preservation faculties in the nation. Students can choose to study in historic preservation/cultural resource management or museum management. Courses in digital history, documentary filmmaking, and oral history allow all students to broaden their experiences. Students from all over the country and all over the world come to MTSU to receive hands-on training from our faculty. Graduate assistantships at the Center for Historic Preservation, the Gore Center, and with Public History faculty provide financial assistance and allow students to work with a range of community partners and clients. These experiences, plus a required internship, prepare students to become public history professionals or to take positions in academia. Our graduates work in a variety of public history jobs in Tennessee and across the country.
MinimumGreScore: combined verbal and quantitative score of 300 and an analytical writing score of 4.0

ProgramName: Master of Fine Arts in Recording Arts and Technologies
Description: The Master of Fine Arts in Recording Arts and Technologies is a terminal degree program designed to prepare students for careers in audio production, research, and post-secondary education. The M.F.A. requires the satisfactory completion of 60 semester hours of graduate credit and is structured to be completed in two calendar years. The first year is focused on advanced recording and mixing techniques in both surround sound and stereo, as well as an introduction to audio research. Students will have significant lab time in MTSU's world-class recording studios. The second year focuses on one of two concentrations: audio production or audio resources.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Aeronautical Science
Concentration: Aviation Education, Aviation Management, Aviation Safety and Security Management, Unmanned Aircraft Systems Operations
Description: The Master of Science in Aeronautical Science (M.S.A.S.) is designed to provide students with a technically oriented and specialized professional master's degree in aviation. The program is specifically for those who wish to work in the many technically advanced and specialized segments of the aviation and aerospace industry. The M.S.A.S. program continues the MTSU Aerospace Department's tradition of bringing together a nationally recognized faculty of experts with an exceptional student body to provide a graduate program of the highest quality. Students can pursue the degree with a thesis option or with a non-thesis option. The thesis option involves the completion of 30 semester hours of coursework. The non-thesis option is comprised of 33 semester hours of coursework.
Accredidation: The Master of Science in Aeronautical Science is accredited by the Aviation Accreditation Board International (AABI).
MinimumGreScore: 294 (new test) or 950 (old test) with 2.7 GPA; 297 (new test) or 1000 (old test) with GPA below 2.7

ProgramName: Master of Science in Aviation Education
Description: The Master of Science degree with a concentration in Aviation Education is designed to provide students with a relevant and focused study of aviation education, training, and research. This concentration is designed for individuals who aspire to enter or advance in an aviation career with a focus on education or training. The concentration appeals to a wide variety of students including K-12 educators, postsecondary aviation faculty, flight instructors, aviation training center instructors, curriculum designers, and many other aviation-related education/training careers. The curriculum provides an in-depth exploration of learning theories, instructional design and delivery, curriculum development, educational assessment, educational research, and educational technology as they relate to the aviation industry.
Accredidation: The M.S. in Aerospace is accredited by the Aviation Accreditation Board International (AABI).
MinimumGreScore: Formula: (200 x GPA + GRE V&Q score) >= 1000

ProgramName: Master of Science in Aviation Management
Description: The Aviation Management concentration is a business-oriented, non-flying degree program designed for students seeking to enter the management side of aviation. The curriculum offers a unique blend of business and aviation courses taught by experienced industry professionals. Graduates go on to leadership positions with airlines, airports, aircraft manufacturers, government organizations (FAA and NASA), consulting firms, and corporate flight departments. Students gain a working knowledge of airline and airport management, aviation law and regulations, aviation safety, and business principles. The curriculum also includes instruction on air traffic control and unmanned aircraft systems (drones).
Accredidation: MTSU's Aerospace Department is a signature department of the University and has earned a national and international reputation for excellence. We are accredited by the Aviation Accreditation Board International (AABI), which is the highest standard of achievement for aviation programs. In fact, MTSU is one of only seven universities in the country to have AABI accreditation in five or more concentrations.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Aviation Safety and Security Management
Description: The Aviation Safety and Security Management concentration is one of three concentrations offered as part of the Master of Science in Aviation degree. MTSU's M.S. in Aviation with a concentration in Aviation Safety and Security Management is one of only a few such programs in the nation. It provides students with comprehensive aviation safety and security coursework designed for professional advancement. The concentration includes unique courses such as Aviation Security, Advanced Aviation Safety, Aviation Accident Investigation, Crew Resource Management, and a graduate capstone project. This program will also allow graduates to earn a graduate certificate in Aviation Safety and Security along with the Master's degree. Students are encouraged to pursue an industry internship. In addition, students complete an appropriate 3-credit capstone experience.
Accredidation: The M.S. in Aviation program is accredited by the Aviation Accreditation Board International (AABI).
MinimumGreScore: 291 (verbal + quantitative) and 3.0 on the analytical writing

ProgramName: Master of Science in Horse Science
Concentration: Equine Education, Equine Physiology, and Industry Management
Description: The Master of Science in Horse Science is a 33-hour degree program with three concentration options: Equine Education, Equine Physiology, and Industry Management. All concentrations require a common core of graduate-level courses that may be applied to any of the concentrations. The required core classes are designed to provide students with a deeper understanding of equine science topics while enhancing their critical-thinking and problem-solving skills. The Master of Science (M.S.) degree in Horse Science offers advanced study in equine science and related subjects. Students will develop skills in research, teaching, and extension methods while increasing their knowledge in specialized areas.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Horse Science - Industry Management
Description: The Master of Science in Horse Science offers a concentration in Industry Management. This program is a 33-hour, non-thesis degree plan. Core courses are online while concentration courses are offered on campus. This degree offers a comprehensive and in-depth study of the equine sciences and related industry practices and is designed for individuals who desire an advanced degree in the equine field. Faculty are well-respected, nationally-known equine experts, and MTSU is well recognized in the horse industry as an institution that produces well-qualified graduates.

ProgramName: Master of Education in Professional Counseling
Concentration: Clinical Mental Health Counseling, School Counseling
Description: The Professional Counseling Program at Middle Tennessee State University provides graduate-level training for individuals who wish to become professional counselors. The program has a practitioner-based focus emphasizing the development of knowledge and skills necessary for the practice of professional counseling. The Professional Counseling Program offers two concentrations: Clinical Mental Health Counseling and School Counseling. The M.Ed. in Professional Counseling is a 60-credit-hour program that meets the educational requirements for licensure in Tennessee as a Licensed Professional Counselor (LPC) or as a Licensed School Counselor. Graduates of both program concentrations have a 100% pass rate on their respective licensure exams for the past several years.
Accredidation: The Clinical Mental Health Counseling and School Counseling programs at Middle Tennessee State University are accredited by the Council for Accreditation of Counseling and Related Educational Programs (CACREP).

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Psychology (Clinical Psychology)
Description: The M.A. in Clinical Psychology program prepares students for Ph.D. programs in clinical or counseling psychology and/or for employment as psychological associates in clinical settings. The curriculum is designed to provide students with a firm foundation in psychology. All students are required to complete courses in the major areas of psychology, in psychological assessment, and in the theory and practice of psychotherapy. Additionally, all students complete a 500-hour practicum at a community agency and a thesis.
Accredidation: The Master of Arts in Clinical Psychology is accredited by the Masters in Psychology and Counseling Accreditation Council (MPCAC) for the period of August 2014 through August 2024.

Description: The Experimental Psychology M.A. Program at Middle Tennessee State University is designed to prepare students for doctoral-level study in all areas of experimental psychology or for master's-level careers in applied research. Experimental psychology broadly refers to the scientific study of psychological processes in human and non-human animals. At MTSU, students can focus on a wide variety of research areas within this discipline, such as cognitive, developmental, industrial/organizational, learning, physiological, or social psychology. The program is specifically tailored for each student, with a focus on psychological research. All students are required to become actively involved in research during their first semester of study, with the goal of producing a high-quality master's thesis by the end of their second year. The program requires 36 hours of graduate coursework, including nine hours of statistics and research design courses and six hours of thesis research.
ScholarshipAmount: Approximately $7,000 for the nine-month academic year

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Psychology (Pre-Specialist in Education - School Psychology Concentration)
Concentration: Pre-Specialist in Education - School Psychology Concentration
Description: This program prepares students for entrance into the Specialist in Education (Ed.S.) degree program in School Psychology at MTSU. The M.A. is not a terminal degree and does not lead to licensure. Students must complete the Ed.S. degree to be eligible for licensure as a school psychologist. However, this M.A. program provides students with experiences and skills needed for success in the Ed.S. program and is a prerequisite for entry into the Ed.S. program for those who do not already have a master's degree in a related field. Students are required to complete a 150-hour practicum that serves as an introduction to school psychological services in the school setting. Students have the opportunity to work in a variety of research labs on topics including autism spectrum disorders, bullying, reading interventions, and academic assessment. NOTE: Admission to this program is for fall only.
MinimumGreScore: preferred combined GRE Verbal and Quantitative score of 297 (1000 on the old GRE) and a preferred score on the GRE Writing Assessment of 4.0

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Psychology (Quantitative Psychology)
Description: The Quantitative Psychology concentration is designed to prepare students for doctoral-level study in quantitative psychology or for master's-level careers in research and data analysis in education, government, and the private sector. The curriculum includes two semesters of statistics (ANOVA and regression), as well as courses in measurement, multivariate statistics, and a variety of elective courses in psychology and research methods. Student research is a primary component of the quantitative program, and students have opportunities to collaborate on research projects with a number of faculty in the department. Quantitative students will complete and defend a master's thesis.

The Master of Accountancy (M.Acc.) is a professional graduate program designed to prepare students for careers in public, private, and governmental accounting. The M.Acc. meets the educational requirements for students to sit for the CPA exam in Tennessee and most other states. The curriculum is designed to enhance the professional competencies of students with an undergraduate degree in accounting.
Accredidation: MTSU's Accounting program, housed in the Jennings A. Jones College of Business, is accredited by AACSB International—The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business.

Description: The Master of Criminal Justice (M.C.J.) degree is for those who want to advance in the criminal justice field, teach at the community college level, or prepare for doctoral-level studies. Offered entirely online, this 36-hour program consists of a 15-hour core, 15 hours of electives, and a 6-hour capstone experience (thesis or professional project).

ProgramName: Master of Science in Engineering Management
Description: The Master of Science in Engineering Management (MSEM) is designed for graduates of engineering, technology, science, and other similar technical programs to prepare them for management or leadership roles in a technical or technology-driven organization. The MSEM degree program can be pursued as either a thesis or non-thesis option. The program consists of 33 semester hours of coursework. All students take five core courses. The remaining 18 credit hours (six courses) are electives. For students pursuing the thesis option, six of these elective hours will be thesis credits. Those on the non-thesis option track must take the capstone course, EMGT 6950, as one of their six electives. The M.S. in Engineering Management provides students with: an understanding of financial and cost accounting in decision-making in a business environment; an understanding of the management of engineering and technology-based projects, especially on project constraints, such as time, cost, and performances; an understanding of managing technical personnel and the technical functions within an organization; an understanding of quality management concepts and their applications; the ability to conduct research and present results in written and oral forms; and the ability to solve a wide variety of engineering management problems.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Athletic Training
Description: The Master of Science in Athletic Training is a 5-semester, 58 credit hour professional program which prepares students to sit for the Board of Certification (BOC) exam and to enter the athletic training profession. Students will complete a variety of clinical experiences, including MTSU athletic teams, local high schools, physician offices, and outpatient rehabilitation clinics. Students will learn how to provide whole-person health care for their patients, which includes prevention, diagnosis, and intervention of emergency, acute, and chronic medical conditions involving impairment, functional limitations, and disabilities. The athletic training program is housed in the Department of Health and Human Performance within the College of Behavioral and Health Sciences. The program accepts a new cohort each summer (May) semester.
Accredidation: The Master of Science in Athletic Training program is accredited by the Commission on Accreditation of Athletic Training Education (CAATE). The program is currently on probation, effective February 19, 2023.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Engineering Technology (Occupational Health and Safety)
Description: The Master of Science in Engineering Technology (M.S.E.T.) is a 30-credit-hour, 100% online program designed to serve the needs of students with undergraduate degrees in technology, engineering, or related science disciplines. The program consists of a 15-credit-hour core and two 15-credit-hour concentration options: Aviation Technology and Occupational Health and Safety. The curriculum provides advanced study for graduate students to develop professional competencies in areas of teaching, training, and administration to create pathways to leadership positions in business and industry, government, and education.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Exercise Science
Description: The Master of Science in Exercise Science program provides a comprehensive study of the theoretical and practical aspects of exercise physiology, biomechanics, and motor behavior. This program is designed to prepare students for careers in clinical, corporate, and academic settings involving physical activity, exercise, and sport. Students develop skills in exercise testing and prescription for a variety of populations. The program also provides excellent preparation for doctoral study in exercise science and related fields.
ScholarshipAmount: Minimum $10,000 stipend for the academic year

Description: The Master of Professional Studies (M.P.S.) is an interdisciplinary master's degree program designed to meet the workforce development needs of the 21st century. The M.P.S. is designed for working adults who wish to develop a set of advanced professional skills that they can apply in their current work environment and also earn a graduate degree. The Leadership in Nutrition concentration is an online, 30-credit hour program that provides students who have completed the Didactic Program in Dietetics (DPD) requirements with an innovative opportunity to build upon their undergraduate nutrition knowledge base by developing graduate level leadership skills that will enhance their professional marketability in the field of nutrition and dietetics. This non-thesis program requires 15 credit hours of core Professional Studies courses and 15 credit hours of Nutrition and Food Science (NFS) courses focused on building leadership and research skills. A capstone project is required.

The Master of Science in Nursing program at MTSU has two concentrations. The Family Nurse Practitioner concentration prepares students to provide primary care to individuals across the lifespan in a variety of settings. The Nursing Education concentration prepares students for roles as educators in a variety of settings. The master's program in nursing at Middle Tennessee State University is accredited by the Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education.
Accredidation: The master's program in nursing at Middle Tennessee State University is accredited by the Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education.

ProgramName: Master in Nursing, Psychiatric Mental Health Nurse Practitioner
Description: The Master of Science in Nursing (M.S.N.) with a concentration as a Psychiatric Mental Health Nurse Practitioner (PMHNP) prepares registered nurses for advanced practice in a variety of settings across the lifespan. Emphasis is on health promotion and disease prevention as well as the diagnosis and management of acute and chronic mental health problems. Successful graduates of the PMHNP concentration are prepared to sit for the ANCC Psychiatric Mental Health Nurse Practitioner (Across the Lifespan) Certification (PMHNP-BC™) exam. The MTSU School of Nursing's M.S.N. program is an online program.
Accredidation: The master's degree program in nursing at Middle Tennessee State University is accredited by the Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education, 655 K Street NW, Suite 750, Washington, DC 20001, (202) 887-6791.

Description: The Master in Physician Assistant Studies (M.P.A.S.) is designed to provide a comprehensive academic and clinical medical education to prepare physician assistants for their professional roles as healthcare providers. Graduates will be eligible to take the Physician Assistant National Certifying Exam (PANCE).
Accredidation:
The ARC-PA has granted Accreditation-Provisional status to the Middle Tennessee State University Physician Assistant Program sponsored by Middle Tennessee State University.

Accreditation-Provisional is an accreditation status granted when the plans and resource allocation, if fully implemented as planned, of a proposed program that has not yet enrolled students appear to demonstrate the program's ability to meet the ARC-PA Standards or when a program holding Accreditation-Provisional status appears to demonstrate continued progress in complying with the Standards as it prepares for the graduation of the first class (cohort) of students.

Accreditation-Provisional does not ensure any subsequent accreditation status. It is limited to no more than five years from matriculation of the first class.
MinimumGreScore: 300 or greater and analytical writing score of 4.0 or greater

ProgramName: Master of Education in Curriculum and Instruction
Concentration: Elementary School Education, Middle Grades Education, Secondary School Education
Description: The Master of Education (M.Ed.) in Curriculum and Instruction is designed to serve the needs of currently licensed teachers seeking an advanced degree. Candidates select one of the following areas of emphasis: elementary school education, middle grades education, or secondary school education. The program consists of a 15-hour core and 15 hours in the area of emphasis. The final course in the program is a capstone experience where candidates complete an action research project in their own classroom or school. The program may lead to a professional teacher's license in states with a tiered licensure system.
Accredidation: MTSU's Educator Preparation Program is accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP). The next accreditation visit is scheduled for Fall 2024.

ProgramName: Master of Education in Digital Teaching and Learning
Description: The Master of Education (M.Ed.) in Curriculum and Instruction with a concentration in Teaching and Innovation in PK-16 is a 30-hour, fully online graduate degree program. Courses are provided online in 8-week formats. The program can be completed in as little as three semesters. The degree program is designed to provide teachers, administrators, and other educators in a variety of learning environments the knowledge, skills, and dispositions to be leaders in PK'16 education. The program focuses on curriculum, instruction, assessment, and innovation across the PK'16 spectrum. A distinctive feature of the program is the opportunity for students to tailor their program of study to fit their needs by selecting from a variety of graduate level elective courses to complete the required 9 hours of electives. Students will also be involved in an authentic, job-embedded action research project to impact student learning in their current professional settings.

ProgramName: Master of Education in Elementary School Education
Description: The Master of Education (M.Ed.) with a major in Curriculum and Instruction offers concentrations for candidates who currently hold a teaching license and those who are seeking an initial teaching license. The Elementary School Education concentration is for candidates who have a valid Tennessee teaching license or a comparable license from another state. The program is designed for currently practicing elementary education teachers who want to strengthen their content knowledge and pedagogy with the goal of improving their practice. MTSU's program focuses on developing advanced skills that will allow teachers to become leaders in their schools and school districts. The program will deepen candidates' understanding of the teaching and learning processes with students from diverse backgrounds and across a range of abilities. All courses are delivered online with a combination of synchronous and asynchronous learning activities.
Accredidation: The Educator Preparation Program at MTSU is accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP). The program is also approved by the Tennessee State Department of Education.

ProgramName: Master of Education in Higher Education
Description: The Master of Education in Higher Education is designed to prepare graduate students for a variety of administrative and leadership roles in postsecondary settings including two- and four-year colleges and universities. The program provides an overview of higher education in the United States, including its history and development, its organization and structure, its functions and missions, its contemporary conditions and challenges, and the issues it will likely face in the future. The program of study covers student affairs, general administration, and academic affairs. Required coursework focuses on American higher education, characteristics of college students, campus diversity, educational research, student development theory, leadership, and legal issues. The curriculum is delivered through a cohort model in a fully online or hybrid format.

The Master of Education (M.Ed.) with a major in Literacy is a 33-hour, non-thesis program designed to prepare certified teachers to work as literacy coaches, reading specialists, and literacy leaders in their schools and districts. Students in this program will learn to use a variety of assessment tools to diagnose reading difficulties; design and deliver culturally responsive reading interventions for students in grades K-12; and provide professional development, coaching, and leadership to classroom teachers and other school personnel in support of school-wide literacy initiatives. Successful completion of this program and a passing score on the Praxis exam (5302) leads to licensure as a PreK-12 Reading Specialist in the state of Tennessee. In addition, candidates who complete this program will have the opportunity to participate in a graduate-level practicum experience in the Center for Dyslexia. Graduates will also have met coursework requirements for Wilson Dyslexia Practitioner Level I certification and will be ready to begin the observation year. Admission is for the fall semester only; all classes are offered online.
Accredidation: The program is accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP). The Reading Specialist program is also nationally recognized by the International Literacy Association (ILA).

ProgramName: Master of Education in Special Education
Concentration: PreK-8 Special Education Interventionist, 6-12 Special Education Interventionist
Description: The Master of Education (M.Ed.) degree with a major in Special Education is an advanced degree designed for individuals who hold a valid teaching license and who wish to obtain an add-on endorsement in Special Education or who wish to seek a master's degree in Special Education. The Special Education, M.Ed. can be completed entirely online. The program requires 33-36 semester hours and may be completed within two years. Candidates choose one of two concentrations: the PreK-8 Special Education Interventionist concentration or the 6-12 Special Education Interventionist concentration.
Accredidation: The special education programs are accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).

Description: The Master of Professional Studies (M.P.S.) is a 30- or 33-credit hour graduate degree designed for working professionals who wish to develop or enhance specific professional skills and advance in their careers. The M.P.S. in Training and Development is a unique, innovative, and attractive program which integrates the knowledge and skill of leadership development with strategic planning. Students gain a better understanding of how people learn and how to best address leadership issues from an educational and learning perspective. Graduates work in a variety of leadership and training positions in business, industry, government, and non-profit settings.

ProgramName: Master of Professional Studies - Leadership in Nutrition
Description: The Master of Professional Studies (M.P.S.) is a 30-33-credit hour graduate degree program with a unique interdisciplinary approach designed to equip students with the skills and competencies required by employers in their chosen professional fields. The degree is nationally recognized and respected. The Leadership in Nutrition concentration is a specialized track designed to broaden the knowledge base and skills of individuals working in nutrition-related fields. The required coursework covers current topics in advanced human nutrition and provides a choice of electives tailored to meet the varied professional needs of prospective students. Individuals will develop leadership skills and a thorough knowledge of research methods appropriate for their professional endeavors.

ProgramName: Master of Education in Administration and Supervision, Higher Education Specialization
Description: The Master of Education (M.Ed.) degree in Administration and Supervision is designed to prepare individuals for a wide variety of leadership positions in schools and school districts. The program has three concentrations for students to choose from. Those who already have a Tennessee teaching license can pursue the K-12 Administration concentration, leading to licensure as a school principal. The Agricultural Education Leadership concentration is designed for those who have a B.S. in an agricultural field. The Higher Education concentration is appropriate for those who wish to work in leadership positions at colleges or universities. The program has a 30-hour option, as well as a 33-hour option that includes a thesis. The Higher Education concentration prepares individuals who aspire to work in administrative and leadership positions in postsecondary settings, such as colleges and universities. No teaching license is required for this concentration.

The Master of Social Work (M.S.W.) is a professional degree designed to prepare students for advanced social work practice. The M.S.W. program's mission is to prepare social work professionals to enhance the well-being and quality of life for all persons, to promote social and economic justice, and to empower people, organizations, and communities through a generalist perspective and advanced clinical social work practice. The program also seeks to meet the needs of the mid-state region for professional social workers. The program focuses on clinical social work. Social work is a diverse and rewarding profession centered on a commitment to human dignity and social justice. Social workers are found in a variety of settings, such as social service agencies, schools, hospitals, courts, and correctional facilities. Social work involves both direct practice with individuals and families and work that is focused on policy and advocacy. The Department of Social Work offers the Master of Social Work degree.
Accredidation: The M.S.W. program at MTSU is accredited by the Council on Social Work Education (CSWE).

Concentration: Professional Mathematics, Mathematics Education, General Mathematics
Description: The Master of Science in Mathematics offers a broad, in-depth study of mathematics, balancing theory and application. The program offers maximum flexibility for students, with a variety of course offerings and three concentrations: Professional Mathematics, Mathematics Education, and General Mathematics. The M.S. in Mathematics program is intended for a broad audience of students, including those in industry, government, research, community college teaching, and those preparing for Ph.D. work in the mathematical sciences. MTSU faculty are active in research in several areas, including mathematics education, data science and statistics, functional analysis and operator theory, graph theory, knot theory, and others. Faculty have a strong record of publications and grant activity and have won numerous awards for teaching excellence and research. Graduate students can expect individual attention and mentoring as well as opportunities for teaching assistantships with full tuition waivers. M.S. students have opportunities to work on research projects with faculty, often leading to presentations and publications.

ProgramName: Doctor of Philosophy in Computational and Data Science
Description: The Ph.D. in Computational and Data Science (CDS) is an interdisciplinary graduate program designed for students who want to use advanced computational methods to solve complex problems. The program has a strong emphasis on data science, high performance computing, and computational modeling. The objective of the program is to provide a comprehensive education in computational and data sciences that will prepare students for careers in academia, industry, and government. The curriculum is flexible and can be tailored to the individual student's interests and career goals. Students in the program will have the opportunity to work with faculty from a variety of disciplines, including computer science, mathematics, statistics, biology, chemistry, physics, and engineering.

ProgramName: Doctor of Philosophy in Mathematics and Science Education
Concentration: Biological Education, Chemical Education, Interdisciplinary Science Education, Mathematics Education
Description: The Mathematics and Science Education Ph.D. program prepares students for careers as leaders in P-12 mathematics and science education. The program focuses on developing expertise in research methodologies related to teaching and learning in mathematics and science. Coursework also focuses on curriculum development and reform, social and political issues surrounding education, equity and access in education, and the use of technology in mathematics and science education.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Mathematics - Actuarial and Financial Mathematics

Concentration: Business Intelligence & Analytics (BI), Finance, Healthcare Management, International Business, Management, Music Business, Supply Chain Management
Description: The Master of Business Administration (M.B.A.) program provides a broad-based, cross-functional business education for individuals seeking careers in management in both the private and public sectors. The MBA curriculum at MTSU has been developed to include the functional areas of business within a framework that provides for analytical, data-driven decision-making and consideration of the contemporary business, professional, and ethical environment. The MBA program also encourages students to develop their creativity and innovative thinking. The MBA degree requires 36 semester hours of graduate course work, including an integrated, problem-solving capstone course in strategic management. This broad-based curriculum provides for a common body of knowledge while being flexible enough to allow students to choose a concentration from a variety of business fields.
Accredidation: The Jennings A. Jones College of Business is one of the 1.5% of business schools worldwide that is accredited in both business and accounting by AACSB International-The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business, the premier accrediting agency for business schools.

Description: The M.B.A. with a concentration in Marketing provides an opportunity for students to study contemporary marketing theory and practice in depth. Students in this program will learn how to design and deliver effective marketing campaigns, how to conduct and analyze market research, and how to make strategic decisions about pricing, product development, distribution, and promotion. The program is designed for students who want to pursue a career in marketing, as well as for those who are already working in marketing and want to advance their careers.
Accredidation: The Jones College of Business is accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools Commission on Colleges (SACSCOC) and the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB) International. AACSB accreditation is the most prestigious and rigorous accreditation a business college can earn.

Description: The Healthcare Management concentration in the Jones College of Business M.B.A. program is a 36-hour program designed for individuals currently employed in or seeking employment in the healthcare industry. Courses are structured to explore current management issues and analyze and evaluate healthcare delivery systems. Students gain an understanding of the unique aspects of the healthcare industry and learn specialized business skills to become effective managers and leaders in the field. Admission to the M.B.A. program is required for those choosing this concentration.
Accredidation: The Jones College of Business is accredited by the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB) International, the premier accrediting agency for business schools.

Description: The strategic marketing analytics concentration prepares students for data-driven careers in marketing. Students in this concentration learn to become both analytical and creative marketing thinkers who can integrate technology with marketing strategy. Students develop skills in areas such as digital marketing, marketing research, and strategic marketing to become knowledgeable managers of information, technology, and marketing strategy. The strategic marketing analytics concentration positions graduates for data-driven careers such as digital marketing analyst, search engine marketing specialist, marketing researcher, social media marketer, and marketing data scientist.
Accredidation: The Jones College of Business is accredited by AACSB International, the premier accrediting body for business schools.

Description: The Master of Business Administration (M.B.A.) degree program is a general, broad-based degree designed to prepare its graduates for a variety of careers in management and leadership in either the private or public sector. The Jennings A. Jones College of Business provides a flexible program that serves both full-time students who have recently completed their undergraduate work as well as part-time students who are currently employed. The curriculum is designed to provide a broad foundation in the various functional areas of business and then allow the student to select an area of concentration in which to obtain more in-depth knowledge.
Accredidation: The Jones College of Business is accredited by the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB) International, the premier accrediting agency for business schools in the world.

Description: Students in the Risk Management and Insurance concentration within the Master of Business Administration program gain an understanding of risk management and insurance from the perspective of society, the insurer, and the policyholder. They acquire a basic knowledge of the role of personal and commercial property and liability insurance in risk management, as well as an understanding of the concepts of risk management, insurer operations and regulation, and key aspects of life and health insurance and related employee benefit plans. Students will be prepared for a wide variety of risk management and insurance industry positions.
Accredidation: AACSB

Description: This concentration prepares a manager to strategically manage human resources. It examines human resources from the viewpoint of a business partner and is ideal for those who are human resource managers, or who aspire to be, and for those who manage people. It provides the skills to create an environment that will result in a motivated and committed workforce. Required courses include Employment Law, Strategic Staffing, Compensation and Benefits, and an elective. All courses are SHRM-aligned.
Accredidation: AACSB Accredited

Description: The Master of Business Administration (M.B.A.) program provides a broad-based graduate business education for students from a variety of academic backgrounds. This professional degree program prepares individuals for responsible managerial positions in business, government, and nonprofit institutions. The program helps students develop and integrate a functional knowledge of marketing, management, finance, accounting, and economics. For those who can benefit from a more specialized program, four concentrations are available: music business, healthcare management, supply chain management, and data analytics. The Data Analytics concentration is an interdisciplinary course of study that combines business analytics, computer information systems, and economics and finance to prepare graduates to manage and utilize big data in a business setting.
Accredidation: AACSB-International

Description: The Master of Business Administration (M.B.A.) program is a broad-based, general management degree designed to prepare students for executive and leadership positions. Leadership and management skills are developed through a core of courses that focus on the functional areas of business and the integration of these areas. Flexibility is provided through a concentration or electives. The Information Technology Project Management concentration focuses on managing and coordinating resources to complete information technology projects on time, within budget, and meeting user specifications. Topics include project integration, project scope management, project time and cost management, quality management, human resource management, communications management, risk management, and procurement management.
Accredidation: The Jones College is one of the top 1.5% of business schools in the world, having maintained its accreditation by the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB) International for over 40 years.

Description: The Music Business concentration offers specialized training for those desiring to work in the dynamic, international music industry. Students are challenged in a rigorous M.B.A. curriculum while taking advantage of the recording industry major in the College of Media and Entertainment. Classes are taught by full-time faculty and an extensive list of adjunct instructors with wide-ranging experience and accomplishments in all facets of the music business. Students gain hands-on experience by networking with and working for a broad range of music industry enterprises.
Accredidation: The Master of Business Administration program is accredited by AACSB International-The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business, the premier accrediting agency for business school programs.

Description: The Bachelor of Arts (B.A.) degree is offered through departments in the Colleges of Behavioral and Health Sciences, Liberal Arts, and Education. This degree requires a minimum of 120 semester hours. Each student must complete a major, General Education requirements, and the B.A. degree requirements which include 6 semester hours of foreign language. Consult the sections for the individual departments in this catalog for specific major requirements. For current degree plans, please click on the following link: Degree Plans.

The Department of Management offers majors in Management, Supply Chain Management, and Entrepreneurship. Our programs are designed to provide students with the knowledge and skills necessary to succeed in a wide range of careers.
CostPerCredit: $416/credit hour (In-State); $1,536/credit hour (Out-of-State), plus a $25/credit hour fee for business courses.

Description: The Bachelor of Fine Arts degree with a concentration in Studio provides a strong professional degree for those students who plan to pursue art as a career and/or continue their education at the graduate level. The B.F.A. is recognized as the professional degree for artists. The degree requires students to complete a strong core of general education, in addition to extensive study in areas such as drawing, painting, sculpture, ceramics, printmaking, photography, or graphic design. Students wishing to be considered for admission to the B.F.A. program must pass a portfolio review.
Accredidation: The Department of Art and Design is an accredited institutional member of the National Association of Schools of Art and Design (NASAD).

Description: The Bachelor of Music (B.M.) degree in Music, Instrumental Music Education Concentration, is designed for students who desire to teach instrumental music (band or orchestra) in public schools. This degree program prepares students for the rigorous demands of instrumental music education through a combination of applied music study, music theory, music history, and pedagogical methods specifically tailored for instrumental music. Graduates of this program will be equipped with the knowledge and skills necessary to create a positive and effective learning environment for K-12 instrumental music students. The curriculum includes extensive practical experience through student teaching and participation in various instrumental ensembles. Upon successful completion of the program and passing appropriate licensure exams, graduates will be eligible for Tennessee teacher licensure in Instrumental Music (K-12).

Do you love science, but you're not sure which specific scientific field you want to pursue? The B.S. in Science, General Science Concentration provides students with a broad scientific background by combining courses in biology, chemistry, geology, and physics. Students are given the flexibility to choose courses that best suit their interests and career goals. This program is suitable for students who wish to pursue a career in science or pursue additional degrees, such as an M.D. or an M.S. in science education. This program provides a solid foundation for those interested in a career in science. Graduates will be well-prepared to pursue employment in various scientific fields, including research, laboratory work, or science education. The flexibility of the General Science Concentration also allows students to prepare for professional programs like medical school, dental school, or pharmacy school.
CostPerCredit: In-State: $441/credit hour; Out-of-State: $1,235/credit hour (based on 2023-2024 rates)
ScholarshipAmount: Up to $5,000 per year for guaranteed scholarships

Description: The Bachelor of Science in Nursing (B.S.N.) program prepares graduates for entry into professional nursing practice and provides the foundation for graduate study. Graduates are prepared as generalists to deliver patient-centered care and function as members of an interdisciplinary health care team, utilizing evidence-based practice, quality improvement, and informatics. Graduates are prepared for leadership roles, professional growth and development, and health care policy. The B.S.N. is a pre-licensure degree program.
Accredidation: The baccalaureate degree program in nursing at Middle Tennessee State University is accredited by the Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education, 655 K Street, NW, Suite 750, Washington, DC 20001, 202-887-6791.

Description: The Bachelor of Social Work (B.S.W.) program at Middle Tennessee State University is committed to preparing students for competent generalist social work practice, graduate studies in social work, and lifelong learning. The B.S.W. program is a generalist social work program designed to provide students with the knowledge, values, and skills necessary for entry-level professional social work practice in a wide variety of settings. The program also prepares students for graduate social work education. The overall mission of the B.S.W. program is to prepare students to be ethical and competent generalist social work practitioners who are committed to social and economic justice and human rights for diverse populations. Students will develop and apply knowledge, values, and skills to empower individuals, families, groups, organizations, and communities through effective interventions, policy analysis, advocacy, and research.
Accredidation: The Middle Tennessee State University Bachelor of Social Work Program is accredited by the Council on Social Work Education (CSWE).

Description: Are you ready for a high-flying career? As a major aerospace hub, Middle Tennessee State University has become a premier choice for students aspiring to work in the aerospace industry. From flight and air traffic control to maintenance and administration, MTSU prepares students for a variety of aerospace careers. The Maintenance Management concentration is designed for students interested in the airline or general aviation maintenance industry or in aerospace manufacturing and repair. The program includes hands-on experience in the classroom and hangar settings at the MTSU Aerospace campus and internships and co-ops with industry partners. Graduates of the program are prepared for careers in a rapidly growing industry, including: Aircraft Maintenance and Repair, Maintenance Management, Quality Control/Assurance, Aircraft Manufacturing, Avionics Technician.
Accredidation: The B.S. in Aerospace degree, with concentrations in Flight, Air Traffic Control, Aerospace Technology, and Maintenance Management, is housed in the Department of Aerospace, which is accredited by the Aviation Accreditation Board International (AABI).

Description: MTSU's Animation program trains students in the art and craft of creating animated films and interactive experiences. Students gain broad exposure to all aspects of the animation pipeline, from story and design to modeling, animation, lighting, texturing, rigging, compositing, and rendering. We emphasize a hands-on approach to learning in a studio-like environment. Small classes and dedicated faculty ensure that students receive individual attention and feedback on their projects. The Animation curriculum prepares students for a career in various areas of the animation industry, including 2D animation, 3D animation, motion graphics, visual effects, and game development. Animation program graduates can pursue careers in a wide range of industries including film, television, video games, advertising, and education. Possible job titles include: 2D Animator, 3D Animator, Motion Graphics Designer, Visual Effects Artist, Technical Artist, Storyboard Artist, Character Designer, Concept Artist, Rigger, Texture Artist, Lighting Artist, Render Wrangler.

As one of the world's premier programs in audio engineering and music production, the Audio Production program prepares students for careers in the audio arts. Housed in the College of Media and Entertainment, the program is unique in its integration of the artistic and scientific elements of audio, with courses ranging from electronic music and critical listening to the physics of sound and advanced digital audio workstation operation. Graduates work as engineers, producers, and technicians in recording studios, live sound venues, broadcast facilities, and other media operations. The Audio Production program provides students with a solid academic foundation and the practical skills needed to be successful in the professional audio world. Core courses focus on topics such as acoustics, critical listening, studio recording techniques, mixing, mastering, and the business of audio. A wide range of electives are available for students to specialize in areas such as live sound, post-production audio for film and video, game audio, electronic music production, and broadcast audio.

The Concrete Industry Management (CIM) program at MTSU is a four-year bachelor of science degree program that began in 1996 to address the need for a management-oriented program specifically designed for the concrete industry. The CIM program has been extremely successful because of the unique partnership between the university, industry, and the patron organizations. The curriculum addresses all aspects of the concrete industry and prepares graduates for careers in management, sales, marketing, production, and quality control. Graduates are in high demand across the United States. Many receive multiple offers from top concrete companies.

Concentration: Science and Technology, Business and Entrepreneurship
Description: Fermentation Science is an interdisciplinary program that draws from the fields of biology, chemistry, and microbiology, along with business and agriculture. Through classroom study and hands-on experiences, students will learn to apply scientific principles to the controlled growth and activity of microorganisms to produce fermented products. Students will develop skills in the areas of analytical chemistry, microbiology, sensory evaluation, and process control. MTSU's Fermentation Science Program is unique in its breadth, encompassing beer, wine, spirits, foods, and industrial fermentation, and in its blend of technical and business courses. Students completing the Fermentation Science program will be prepared to enter the workforce in a variety of fermentation industries including brewing, distilling, winemaking, food, and industrial applications. Students can also prepare for graduate school or professional school programs.

Middle Tennessee State University's Mechatronics Engineering Bachelor of Science degree is the first of its kind in Tennessee. Mechatronics combines mechanical engineering, electrical engineering, computer science, and control engineering, resulting in a synergistic system that integrates these fields. As automation and smart technologies rapidly become the norm across industries, Mechatronics Engineering plays a vital role in designing, implementing, and maintaining them. Our program emphasizes hands-on learning, design projects, and industry partnerships to provide students with practical skills and real-world experience. With a Mechatronics Engineering degree from MTSU, you'll be at the forefront of innovation. You will learn to design, build, and maintain intelligent systems, robots, and automated processes. This interdisciplinary field opens doors to diverse career paths in manufacturing, aerospace, automotive, healthcare, and more. Our graduates are well-prepared to tackle complex challenges and contribute to technological advancements. Core areas of study include: Mechanical Systems, Electrical Systems, Control Systems, Computer Programming, Robotics, Automation.
Accredidation: The Bachelor of Science in Engineering Technology degree with a concentration in Mechatronics Engineering is accredited by the Engineering Technology Accreditation Commission of ABET, http://www.abet.org.

ProgramName: Recording Industry, B.S. (Commercial Songwriting | Music Business)
Description: MTSU's Department of Recording Industry, founded in 1973, is recognized as one of the oldest and most respected programs globally and is consistently ranked among the nation's top music business schools by Billboard. Housed in the university's College of Media and Entertainment, the department offers students a hands-on, professionally oriented curriculum. It provides state-of-the-art facilities, including seven recording studios, two mixing labs, a mastering lab, and a new live sound studio. Students also have opportunities for internships and other experiential learning activities. The faculty includes Grammy-nominated engineers, producers, and songwriters. Alumni have a strong record of success, routinely working on Grammy- and Dove Award-winning projects, with several inducted into the TEC Awards Hall of Fame.
CostPerCredit: In-State: $372/Credit Hour; Out-of-State: $1,104/Credit Hour (based on 2024-2025 rates)

ProgramName: Video & Film Production, B.S. (Live Production and Filmmaking concentrations)
Description: The Video & Film Production program at Middle Tennessee State University has been preparing students for careers in the television and film industries for more than 40 years. Our graduates are equipped with technical and aesthetic skills to create visual stories and produce a wide array of content for broadcast, cable, streaming services, and the big screen. You'll gain a strong foundation in visual storytelling, critical analysis, aesthetic development, professional ethics, and research and writing. The curriculum also provides experience in all aspects of production from concept to distribution, including camera operation, lighting, sound recording, editing, and post-production. You'll choose one of two concentrations: Live Production, which trains students to work in multi-camera studio and remote environments; or Filmmaking, which prepares students for careers in single-camera production environments like narrative and documentary film. Both concentrations emphasize collaboration and hands-on learning with industry-standard equipment and facilities.

ProgramName: Aerospace B.S. (Aviation Management, Flight Dispatch, Maintenance Management, Professional Pilot, Technology only)
Concentration: Aviation Management, Flight Dispatch, Maintenance Management, Professional Pilot, Aerospace Technology
Description: MTSU's Aerospace Department is the largest and most comprehensive university-level aviation program in Tennessee and one of the largest in the nation. It boasts a diverse fleet of aircraft, state-of-the-art simulators, and dedicated faculty, offering a rich educational experience for aspiring aviation professionals. The Bachelor of Science in Aerospace prepares students for a variety of aviation careers.
