Accredidation: MTSU's Jones College of Business is among the top 1.5% of business schools worldwide to be accredited by AACSB International.

Description: In the MTSU Marketing Digital Marketing concentration, you'll delve into the strategies and tactics essential for success in today's digital landscape. This program is tailored for students eager to specialize in the dynamic world of online marketing, covering everything from search engine optimization (SEO) and social media marketing to content strategy and analytics. As a student in this program, you will develop key skills in: * Crafting engaging digital content * Analyzing marketing data to inform decisions * Managing social media campaigns * Optimizing online presence for maximum impact * Understanding consumer behavior in digital environments
Accredidation: AACSB International accreditation

Description: In today's global economy, marketing is essential for any business and requires qualified professionals trained in various aspects of the discipline. The Department of Marketing offers the Bachelor of Business Administration (B.B.A.) in Marketing with concentrations in General Marketing, Professional Selling, and Digital Marketing. The Professional Selling concentration prepares students for careers in sales, sales management, and business-to-business marketing, among others. Students learn about the various stages of the selling process, managing a sales force, and how to effectively communicate and negotiate with customers. Graduates are well-prepared for entry-level sales positions or for advanced study in related fields.
ScholarshipAmount: Guaranteed scholarships range from $2,000 to $3,500 per year; competitive scholarships can provide up to a full tuition waiver or $8,000 per year.

ProgramName: Mathematical Sciences, Actuarial Science Concentration, B.S.

Description: MTSU's Mathematics B.S. degree is offered with four concentrations: Actuarial Science, Data Science, Mathematics, and Secondary Education. The Mathematics Concentration is for students who want to build a solid foundation in mathematics while preparing for graduate school or careers in a wide array of fields requiring strong analytical skills. You will take courses in discrete mathematics, modern algebra, calculus, and mathematical statistics, among others, to give you a deep understanding of mathematical theory and its applications. Potential career paths include statistics, operations research, data analysis, and many others.

ProgramName: Mathematical Sciences, Mathematics Teacher Licensure Concentration, B.S.
Description: The B.S. in Mathematical Sciences with a concentration in Mathematics Teacher Licensure prepares students for careers as secondary mathematics teachers. Students completing the program will meet all requirements for a secondary mathematics teaching license in Tennessee (grades 6-12). The program includes course work in the major areas of mathematics (calculus, linear algebra, abstract algebra, geometry, probability and statistics, modeling) as well as professional education courses. Students will have multiple opportunities to observe and participate in classroom activities at the secondary level prior to a full semester of student teaching.

The B.S. in Mathematical Sciences provides students with a strong foundational knowledge in a broad range of mathematical topics. The Statistics concentration focuses on probabilistic, statistical and mathematical modeling techniques. Graduates are prepared for a variety of careers in industry and government and for graduate study in mathematics or statistics.

Concentration: Commercial Music, Music Education, Music Industry, Performance, Theory/Composition, Jazz Studies
Description:
The Bachelor of Music (B.M.) degree is designed for students who desire to pursue professional careers as musicians and for those who wish to continue their education at the graduate level.

B.M. Commercial Music: The Commercial Music Program is designed for students seeking careers in music performance, songwriting, audio engineering, and music production. Students gain hands-on experience through studio recording, live sound reinforcement, and audio post-production projects. The program emphasizes improvisation, composition, and technology, preparing students for the evolving demands of the music industry. Graduates are equipped for roles as performers, composers, producers, and audio engineers.

B.M. Music Education: The Music Education Program prepares students to become certified music teachers in K-12 public and private school settings. The curriculum combines extensive musical training with pedagogical instruction, field experiences, and student teaching placements. Students develop proficiency in instrumental and vocal performance, conducting, music theory, and music history, along with effective teaching methodologies. Graduates are eligible for Tennessee state licensure and are prepared to foster musical growth in young learners.

B.M. Music Industry: The Music Industry Program offers a comprehensive education in the business aspects of music. Students explore areas such as artist management, record label operations, music publishing, live entertainment, and digital music marketing. The curriculum integrates business principles with practical industry experience through internships and hands-on projects. Graduates are prepared for diverse roles in the music business, including artist managers, marketing specialists, music publishers, and venue operators.

B.M. Performance: The Performance Program focuses on developing advanced musical skills and artistry for students aspiring to professional performance careers. Students receive intensive private instruction on their primary instrument or voice, participate in a variety of ensembles, and engage in solo recitals. The curriculum covers advanced music theory, history, and repertoire, fostering comprehensive musicianship. Graduates are prepared for careers as professional performers, ensemble musicians, or for advanced graduate studies in performance.

B.M. Theory/Composition: The Theory/Composition Program is designed for students with a passion for creating and analyzing music. Students engage in rigorous study of advanced music theory, counterpoint, orchestration, and various compositional techniques. They have opportunities to compose original works for diverse ensembles and have their compositions performed. The program fosters critical listening, analytical thinking, and creative expression. Graduates are prepared for careers as composers, arrangers, theorists, or for graduate studies in music theory and composition.

B.M. Jazz Studies: The Jazz Studies Program provides specialized training in jazz performance, improvisation, theory, and history. Students receive private instruction on their instrument, participate in jazz ensembles, and develop skills in jazz arranging and composition. The curriculum emphasizes improvisational techniques, jazz harmony, and an understanding of the historical and cultural context of jazz. Graduates are prepared for careers as jazz performers, educators, arrangers, or for further specialized study in jazz.
Accredidation: MTSU is an accredited institutional member of the National Association of Schools of Music (NASM). All music degree programs are accredited by NASM.

Description: The Recording Industry Department offers a Bachelor of Science (B.S.) in Recording Industry with three concentrations: Audio Production, Commercial Songwriting, and Music Business. This particular page describes the Commercial Songwriting concentration. This program is for students who want to develop their skills in writing songs for a variety of commercial music applications, including pop, country, R&B, and film/TV. Students will learn the craft of songwriting, music theory, audio production techniques, and business aspects of the music industry. The curriculum focuses on developing creative and technical skills necessary to succeed as a professional songwriter, including collaboration, demo production, and copyright. Graduates are prepared for careers as staff songwriters, artists who write their own material, composers for film/TV, and other roles in the creative side of the music industry.
CostPerCredit: In-state: ~$419/credit hour; Out-of-state: ~$1,177/credit hour (based on 2024-2025 tuition and mandatory fees)
ScholarshipAmount: Up to $7,000/year for guaranteed academic scholarships.

Description: The Music Business concentration (B.S.) combines coursework in the Recording Industry Department with a full music minor in the School of Music, and is designed to provide students with a solid foundation in the history, theory, and business of music while also allowing flexibility for students to pursue a wide range of career interests. This includes careers in artist management, concert promotion, music publishing, entrepreneurship, live sound, studio recording, and more. A minor in Music is required with this major.
Accredidation: MTSU is an accredited institutional member of the National Association of Schools of Music (NASM).

Description: Music industry is one of the largest employers of musicians and those interested in a creative path. Music industry professionals can be found in publishing, recording, concert production, artist management, marketing, sound engineering, retailing, and instrument manufacturing, to name a few of the many career options. They work as songwriters, performers, producers, arrangers, agents, attorneys, publicists, retailers, and entrepreneurs in a competitive but rewarding environment. Our program, located in a national hub of the music business, provides the skills and experience you will need to succeed.
Accredidation: The MTSU School of Music is an institutional member of the National Association of Schools of Music (NASM) and is accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools Commission on Colleges (SACSCOC).

Concentration: Instrumental Performance Concentration (Brass, Orchestral Strings, Woodwinds, and Percussion)
Description: The B.M. in Instrumental Performance with a concentration in Brass, Orchestral Strings, Woodwinds, and Percussion provides students with a high level of training needed for careers as performing artists, studio musicians, and teachers. The comprehensive curriculum allows students to gain the skills needed to pursue careers as performers, educators, and leaders in the field of music. Along with private lessons, students will gain experience through instrumental ensembles and chamber music. The curriculum also includes coursework in music theory, history, and keyboard skills. Additionally, students will develop musicianship skills in ear training, sight-singing, and improvisation.

The Bachelor of Music (B.M.) in Music with a concentration in Music Studies is a non-performance degree designed to provide students with a broad background in music. This concentration is ideal for students who wish to pursue graduate study in musicology, music theory, composition, or other academic areas of music. It is also suitable for students interested in careers in arts administration, music criticism, or other music-related fields that do not require extensive performance training. The curriculum emphasizes a strong foundation in music theory, music history, and musicianship, along with opportunities for elective studies in areas such as composition, conducting, and world music.
Accredidation: The School of Music at Middle Tennessee State University is an accredited institutional member of the National Association of Schools of Music (NASM). All music degree programs are approved by NASM. This accreditation ensures that our programs meet national standards for quality music instruction and prepares students for successful careers in music.
ScholarshipAmount: Awards range from $500 to $5,000 per year

ProgramName: Music, Music Theory and Composition Concentration, B.M.
Description: The MTSU School of Music is proud to offer two degree programs for students interested in writing music: Music Theory & Composition and Commercial Songwriting. We believe that composers need to be versatile, so we teach a broad range of styles to prepare students for the variety of career paths available to them. This will include not only Western classical music but also jazz and popular music styles. As a student in the Music Theory & Composition program, you will develop your skills in traditional and contemporary techniques of composition, score reading, sight-singing, and ear training. You will receive private lessons on your primary instrument and in composition, study counterpoint and form and analysis, and attend seminars on composition. There are also frequent opportunities for you to hear your works performed by fellow students or by faculty members. In addition, all students participate in recitals, workshops, and other performances both on and off campus. Graduates of the program are well prepared for careers as composers and arrangers in the classical, popular, and commercial music fields. They also pursue graduate studies in composition or music theory.
Accredidation: The MTSU School of Music is an accredited institutional member of the National Association of Schools of Music (NASM).

Description: At MTSU, instrumental performance majors have the opportunity to study with outstanding artist-teachers in state-of-the-art facilities. Graduates go on to successful careers as performers, educators, and administrators, and many continue their studies in graduate school. With the largest college of music in Tennessee and one of the finest in the Southeast, MTSU is the perfect place to hone your musical skills. Students may major in piano, organ, voice, guitar, orchestral strings, brass, woodwinds, or percussion. The Bachelor of Music degree with a concentration in Instrumental Performance provides intensive study in a student's major performing medium and related fields. Courses in theory, history, and ensemble provide the necessary background to develop comprehensive musicianship. Many performance opportunities are available in MTSU's numerous performing ensembles, including orchestral, band, jazz, chamber, and opera/music theatre productions.
CostPerCredit: In-State: $318/credit hour; Out-of-State: $1078/credit hour (Maintenance Fee only, additional fees apply)

Fees: The annual tuition and mandatory fees for a full-time undergraduate student for 2023-2024 are $10,060 for Tennessee residents and $29,164 for out-of-state students. An additional Applied Music Fee of $75 per semester hour of credit (capped at $150 per semester) may apply.
Description: The Bachelor of Music (B.M.) in Music with a concentration in Theatre is a professional degree for students who intend to pursue careers in music theatre or who intend to pursue graduate studies in music theatre, vocal performance, or theatre. With a focus on both vocal and dramatic training, the program provides students with a strong foundation in music theory, history, and performance, as well as acting, dance, and stagecraft. Students gain experience in a variety of performance settings through opportunities in MTSU's opera, musical theatre, and play productions, as well as solo and ensemble performances.
Accredidation: The School of Music is an accredited institutional member of the National Association of Schools of Music (NASM).
CostPerCredit: In-State: $323/credit hour; Out-of-State: $1119/credit hour (tuition only, additional fees apply)
ScholarshipAmount: University-wide scholarships available up to $5,000 per year. School of Music scholarships range from partial fee waivers to full tuition.

Description: The Bachelor of Science in Nursing (B.S.N.) is a professional nursing program designed to prepare generalist nurses to practice in a variety of settings and to provide a foundation for graduate study. Graduates are eligible to apply to take the National Council Licensure Examination (NCLEX-RN) for licensure as a Registered Nurse. The School of Nursing is committed to providing quality educational opportunities to a diverse student body, fostering professional growth and development, and preparing graduates to meet the current and future healthcare needs of the community. In addition to gaining expertise in the classroom, students receive extensive clinical experience in a wide variety of healthcare settings.
Accredidation: The baccalaureate degree program in nursing at Middle Tennessee State University is accredited by the Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education (http://www.ccneaccreditation.org).

Concentration: Social and Political Philosophy OR Logic and the Philosophy of Science
Description: A bachelor's degree in Philosophy provides a solid foundation for careers in law, government, business, journalism, and more. Critical thinking, strong communication skills, and the ability to analyze complex arguments are some of the hallmarks of a good philosophy program and the skills that employers demand from college graduates. MTSU's Department of Philosophy and Religious Studies is recognized for its excellence in teaching and research, and faculty are dedicated to providing a rigorous and rewarding educational experience for students. Students can choose between two areas of emphasis in their Philosophy B.A.: Social and Political Philosophy OR Logic and the Philosophy of Science.
ScholarshipAmount: Varies, with guaranteed academic scholarships ranging from $3,500 to $5,000 per year.

Description: Physics, Applied Physics Concentration, B.S. will provide students with the ability to integrate physics principles with their applications and to develop solutions to real-world problems. This concentration provides a solid foundation for students planning careers in industry or government research facilities, or who intend to pursue graduate studies in physics or engineering. Physics is an exciting field, fundamental to all the sciences, encompassing the study of nature at its most basic level, from the elementary particles that make up matter to the large-scale structure of the universe. Studying physics helps students develop critical thinking and quantitative reasoning skills that are valuable in a wide range of careers.
CostPerCredit: In-state: $320/credit hour (tuition only); Out-of-state: $1076/credit hour (tuition only)

ScholarshipAmount: Varies, from $2,000/year to full tuition waiver

Description: Physics, B.S. with a Physics Teaching concentration is designed to produce highly qualified graduates in Physics who are eligible to be licensed to teach high school Physics. The curriculum meets the requirements set forth by the Tennessee Department of Education for licensure in Physics (grades 9-12). All students complete the same core courses in physics including Mechanics, Electricity and Magnetism, Optics, Modern Physics, and Quantum Mechanics. Students also complete courses in mathematics through Differential Equations. The Physics Teaching concentration also provides courses in pedagogy and methods of teaching Physics through the Department of Education. Graduates of this concentration are also prepared to enter graduate school in Physics, Engineering, or other related fields.

The Bachelor of Science (B.S.) in Physics offers a comprehensive study of physics through a combination of traditional classroom instruction and hands-on laboratory experience. Students learn through experimentation, observation, and measurement while developing critical thinking, problem-solving, and analytical skills necessary to succeed in a wide range of career paths or graduate studies. The program covers mechanics, electricity and magnetism, quantum mechanics, and thermodynamics. In addition, students gain proficiency in experimental design, data analysis, and scientific communication. Students in the Professional Physics Concentration will learn: Fundamental principles of physics, including mechanics, electricity and magnetism, quantum mechanics, and thermodynamics; Experimental design, data analysis, and scientific communication; Critical thinking, problem-solving, and analytical skills; The applications of physics to various fields, such as engineering, medicine, and research. The curriculum provides a strong foundation for students pursuing careers in physics, engineering, or related fields, as well as those planning to attend graduate school.

ProgramName: Physics, Quantum Science and Computing Concentration, B.S.
Description:
This concentration in the Physics B.S. degree program prepares students for graduate studies and careers in quantum science and engineering. This includes quantum computing, quantum information, quantum sensing, quantum imaging, quantum communication, and other emerging quantum technologies. It also provides a strong foundation for a variety of careers in other STEM fields.
The curriculum focuses on the theoretical and experimental foundations of quantum mechanics, quantum computing, quantum information, and quantum materials. Students will develop skills in quantum programming, laboratory techniques, and scientific communication. Through a combination of coursework, research opportunities, and hands-on projects, students will gain a deep understanding of the principles and applications of quantum science and computing.

Students majoring in Plant and Soil Science at MTSU develop expertise in the fundamental principles of plant growth, soil management, and sustainable agricultural practices. This program prepares students for a wide array of career opportunities in agriculture, environmental science, and related industries. Through a blend of rigorous coursework, hands-on laboratory experiences, and fieldwork, students gain practical skills and theoretical knowledge essential for addressing contemporary challenges in food production, resource management, and environmental sustainability. The curriculum covers areas such as crop science, soil fertility, plant pathology, entomology, horticulture, and environmental regulations, ensuring a comprehensive understanding of the plant and soil ecosystems.

Political Science is the systematic study of political systems, governments, and politics. In an age of increasing globalization and interdependence, a thorough grounding in Political Science and its related disciplines is vital for citizens to understand the issues they face and the choices they make. Such an understanding is also vital for students who intend to pursue careers in the legal profession, public service (local, state, national, and international), interest groups, journalism, business, education, campaign management, or public policy analysis. Our program is designed to provide students with comprehensive knowledge in Political Science as well as develop skills in critical thinking, writing, research, and oral communication. We are committed to an educational experience that cultivates active and ethical citizenship. Students may choose a general Political Science curriculum or specialize in one of three concentrations: Pre-Law, Public Administration, and International Relations. A Political Science minor is also available.

ProgramName: Professional Studies, Health Administration Concentration, B.S.
Description: The Bachelor of Science in Professional Studies with a concentration in Health Administration is designed for individuals with a two-year technical or occupational degree who want to advance into leadership and supervisory roles in healthcare. This program will provide students with the knowledge and skills necessary to pursue administrative positions in hospitals, clinics, nursing homes, and other healthcare organizations. With a solid foundation in the principles of management, finance, marketing, human resources, and healthcare policy, graduates will be well-prepared to address the complex challenges facing today's healthcare industry. The curriculum focuses on developing critical thinking, problem-solving, and communication skills, ensuring that students are equipped to effectively lead and manage healthcare teams and organizations. In addition, the program offers flexibility through online course delivery, allowing students to balance their academic pursuits with their professional and personal commitments.

ProgramName: Professional Studies, Information Technology Concentration, B.S.
Description: The Bachelor of Science degree in Professional Studies with a concentration in Information Technology prepares students for various information technology roles. This program is designed for students who have prior learning from professional, military, or technical sources. The curriculum balances general education with core courses in professional studies and specialized courses in information technology. Students will gain skills in areas such as networking, cybersecurity, database management, and software development, essential for today's dynamic IT landscape. Graduates will be equipped to apply critical thinking and problem-solving skills to real-world IT challenges, advancing their careers or pursuing further education.

ProgramName: Professional Studies, International Organizational Leadership Concentration, B.S.
ScholarshipPercentage: Nearly 80% of students receive financial assistance

ProgramName: Professional Studies, Organizational Leadership Concentration, B.S.
Description: The Bachelor of Science in Professional Studies provides students with a broad interdisciplinary education that combines both a professional core and a concentration of specialized knowledge. This degree is designed to meet the growing need for adult and nontraditional students to complete an undergraduate degree that will enhance their career opportunities. Each concentration provides students with the critical thinking, communication, and technological skills required to become leaders in a variety of fields and organizations. The Organizational Leadership concentration prepares students to be leaders by providing them with the necessary skills to effectively lead others, manage resources, and achieve organizational goals. Students gain a comprehensive understanding of leadership theories, organizational behavior, ethics, and strategic planning within a variety of organizational settings.

The Bachelor of Science (B.S.) in Psychology at Middle Tennessee State University provides a comprehensive curriculum covering the breadth of psychology as a science and a profession. Students gain a foundational understanding of human thought, emotion, and behavior through core courses in research methods, statistics, and various subfields of psychology such as developmental, cognitive, social, and abnormal psychology. The program emphasizes critical thinking, scientific inquiry, and ethical considerations, preparing students for diverse career paths or advanced graduate studies. With a focus on empirical research and practical application, graduates are equipped with analytical skills valuable in many professional settings.

The Public Health program offers a Bachelor of Science (B.S.) in Public Health that provides students with the knowledge and skills necessary to address complex health challenges at the local, national, and global levels. The curriculum emphasizes health promotion, disease prevention, and health equity, preparing graduates for careers in diverse public health settings.
This program offers two concentrations:
*   Community Health Education: Focuses on developing and implementing health education programs.
*   Health Administration: Focuses on the management and leadership aspects of public health organizations.

This program will prepare you for a variety of entry-level public health positions in local, state, and national governmental agencies; non-profit organizations; hospitals and clinics; and private businesses. Graduates are also prepared for graduate study in public health or related fields.

Concentration: Audio Production, Commercial Songwriting, Music Business
Description:
MTSU's Recording Industry program is considered one of the best and largest in the world. The department is a leader in developing cutting-edge curricula that prepare graduates for success in the dynamic and evolving media and entertainment industries. With programs in Audio Production, Commercial Songwriting, and Music Business, the Department of Recording Industry offers a solid foundation for anyone interested in making a career in the recording arts and sciences.

The Recording Industry B.S. program is a rigorous, professionally oriented course of study. Whether it is sound reinforcement for live performance, digital audio workstation skills for studio production, music publishing, or artist management, this comprehensive program gives students the opportunity to learn and develop skills in state-of-the-art facilities with award-winning faculty. Students also benefit from an active and engaged student body and a vast network of successful alumni.

ProgramName: Recording Industry, Audio Production Concentration, B.S.
Description: The Bachelor of Science (B.S.) in Recording Industry with a concentration in Audio Production prepares students for careers in the professional audio industries. The curriculum provides a balance between theoretical knowledge and practical applications in the areas of music production, sound reinforcement, and audio post-production. The program's main emphasis is on the creative use of technology in the art of recorded and live sound. Students are trained in multi-track recording, mixing, mastering, and the use of current digital audio workstations (DAW). The curriculum focuses on critical listening, problem-solving, and developing a strong aesthetic for sound. The Audio Production concentration prepares students to work in commercial recording studios, post-production houses, live sound production companies, video game audio, and broadcast facilities.

ProgramName: Recording Industry, Commercial Songwriting Concentration, B.S.
Description: MTSU's Recording Industry program is widely recognized as one of the best in the world. Its alumni work in every facet of the industry, and its facilities offer cutting-edge technology and learning opportunities. The Commercial Songwriting concentration, a Bachelor of Science (B.S.) degree, provides a unique opportunity to study the art and craft of songwriting while simultaneously learning about the business of music. Students gain proficiency in music theory and performance while developing their own personal songwriting style. Topics such as copyright, publishing, and licensing are covered from an industry perspective. This program is offered in the College of Media and Entertainment. Upon completion of the B.S. in Recording Industry: Commercial Songwriting, students will be prepared for a career in music publishing, songwriting, or other aspects of the music business.

ProgramName: Recording Industry, Music Business Concentration, B.S.
Fees: $10,760 per year (in-state, based on 2024-2025 rates for tuition and mandatory fees)
Description: MTSU's Bachelor of Science in Recording Industry offers three concentrations: Audio Production, Commercial Songwriting, and Music Business. Each concentration provides a specialized course of study to prepare students for a variety of careers in the professional sound and music industries. Through hands-on experience and instruction from faculty who are also industry professionals, students gain the expertise needed for success. Housed in the College of Media and Entertainment, the department maintains seven state-of-the-art recording studios, including one of the finest live performance venues, two mixing labs, and a mastering lab, allowing students to develop and hone skills at a level consistent with professional standards. The department also operates an in-house record label, Match Records, and provides students with internship opportunities with area employers as well as Nashville's music industry.
Accredidation: Middle Tennessee State University is accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools Commission on Colleges (SACSCOC) to award associate, baccalaureate, master's, and doctor's degrees. Programs in the College of Media and Entertainment are also accredited by the Accrediting Council on Education in Journalism and Mass Communications (ACEJMC).

Description: The Religious Studies program at MTSU offers an interdisciplinary approach to the academic study of religion. Our curriculum is designed to introduce students to the diverse religious traditions of the world, explore the theoretical and methodological approaches to studying religion, and foster critical thinking skills regarding the role of religion in human societies past and present. Students will examine religious texts, practices, beliefs, and institutions from a global perspective, developing a nuanced understanding of their historical, cultural, and social contexts. Through our courses, students will cultivate analytical abilities, research skills, and an appreciation for cultural diversity. The program prepares students for a variety of career paths where an understanding of global cultures and critical inquiry is valued, including education, journalism, non-profit organizations, government, law, social services, and religious leadership. It also provides an excellent foundation for graduate studies in Religious Studies, Theology, History, Sociology, and other humanities and social science fields.

ProgramName: Science, Allied Health Science Concentration, B.S.
Fees: In-State: $4,887 per semester; Out-of-State: $14,139 per semester (based on 12+ credit hours for Fall 2023/Spring 2024)
Description: The Bachelor of Science degree in Science with a concentration in Allied Health Science provides a solid foundation for students pursuing careers in allied health fields. This program is ideal for students who wish to apply to professional programs such as physical therapy, occupational therapy, physician assistant, chiropractic, or optometry. It can also prepare students for direct entry into some allied health professions.
CostPerCredit: In-State: $407.75 per credit hour; Out-of-State: $1,177.75 per credit hour (for Fall 2023/Spring 2024)
ScholarshipAmount: Up to $6,000 per year for guaranteed freshman scholarships.

ProgramName: Science, Allied Health Technology Concentration, B.S.
Fees: In-state: $9,321/year; Out-of-state: $28,713/year (based on 2024-2025 rates for full-time enrollment)
Description:
The B.S. in Science, Allied Health Technology Concentration, is an interdisciplinary degree developed in collaboration with area colleges of medicine, dentistry, pharmacy, and allied health to meet the academic preparation for students wishing to apply to professional schools in the allied health professions. Coursework emphasizes a strong background in the basic sciences in preparation for the rigorous demands of professional school curricula. Students completing this concentration will find it to be a unique path leading to various professional health careers.
This concentration is designed for students seeking entry into professional health programs such as dentistry, medicine, occupational therapy, optometry, pharmacy, physical therapy, physician's assistant, and veterinary medicine. Students are encouraged to explore their options with the Pre-Professional Health Advising program early in their academic career.

Middle Tennessee State University's Science, General Science Concentration, B.S. provides students with a broad background in the sciences. The curriculum provides a strong foundation in biology, chemistry, and physics while offering flexibility for students to explore their interests. The General Science B.S. degree is ideal for students who want to develop a broad understanding of science, pursue a career in science education, or prepare for graduate studies in interdisciplinary fields. It also prepares students for careers in fields that require a strong understanding of scientific principles, such as technical writing, science communication, and public policy. The program can also serve as a strong foundation for students interested in a variety of pre-professional programs (Pre-med, Pre-dental, Pre-veterinary, Pre-pharmacy, etc.). The General Science B.S. concentration allows students to select 18 hours of science electives (biology, chemistry, or physics) to create an individualized program of study tailored to their career goals. Students in this program will learn to think critically, solve problems, and communicate effectively, all skills essential for success in a rapidly changing world.
CostPerCredit: In-State: $419/credit hour; Out-of-State: $1197/credit hour (based on 2023-24 rates)
ScholarshipPercentage: 66% of full-time undergraduates received institutional grant/scholarship aid

ProgramName: Science, Medical School Early Acceptance Program (MSEAP), B.S.
Description: The Medical School Early Acceptance Program (MSEAP) is designed for exceptional high school students who are highly motivated to pursue a career in medicine. Students selected for this program are conditionally admitted to Meharry Medical College (MMC) through a partnership between MTSU and MMC. MSEAP students are guaranteed admission to MMC upon successful completion of an MTSU Bachelor of Science (B.S.) degree and MSEAP program requirements, including maintaining a minimum GPA and completing required coursework and experiences. The program aims to provide a clear pathway and strong support system for students committed to medical school, including specialized advising, mentorship, research opportunities, and clinical exposure.

The Bachelor of Social Work (B.S.W.) is a professional degree designed to prepare students for generalist social work practice. The curriculum prepares students to work with diverse populations in various social service settings. Social work is a profession for those who are committed to promoting social justice and human rights, enhancing individual and social well-being, alleviating poverty, and enhancing the quality of life for all people. The MTSU B.S.W. program is committed to a liberal arts perspective, social justice, and respect for diversity. The program prepares students for beginning professional generalist social work practice and for graduate study in social work and related fields. The program educates students about social welfare policy and services, human behavior in the social environment, social work practice methods, research, and field experience.
Accredidation: The MTSU Bachelor of Social Work (B.S.W.) Program is accredited by the Council on Social Work Education (CSWE) Commission on Accreditation. Initial Accreditation was granted in Spring 2021. For more information, you may contact the CSWE.
ScholarshipAmount: Up to $5,000/year for guaranteed freshman scholarships

Description: Sociology is the scientific study of human society, social behavior, and social structure. Sociologists examine how social forces influence individual behavior, group dynamics, and societal institutions. Students in the Sociology program develop a strong foundation in sociological theory, research methods, and data analysis. They gain critical thinking skills, cultural awareness, and a global perspective applicable to diverse career paths. The B.A. degree emphasizes a broad liberal arts education, while the B.S. degree focuses on quantitative skills and research applications. Our program prepares students for various professions in fields such as social work, counseling, public administration, law, education, journalism, urban planning, human resources, market research, and non-profit management. It also provides an excellent foundation for graduate studies in sociology or related disciplines.
CostPerCredit: In-State: $545.00/credit hour; Out-of-State: $1,159.00/credit hour (for Fall 2024 - Spring 2025)
ScholarshipAmount: Guaranteed scholarships range from $3,500 to $8,000 per year

Description: The Bachelor of Science in Sociology, Criminology Concentration, is designed to provide students with a solid foundation in the study of crime and the criminal justice system. The curriculum includes courses on theoretical explanations of crime, research methods in criminology, social control, and various aspects of the justice system such as policing, courts, and corrections. Students will develop critical thinking skills, analytical abilities, and an understanding of social justice issues related to crime and punishment. Students in the Criminology Concentration will gain a comprehensive understanding of the causes and consequences of crime, as well as the societal responses to it. The program emphasizes critical thinking and analytical skills, preparing students for a variety of careers in criminal justice, social work, law, and public service. Graduates are well-prepared for roles in law enforcement, probation and parole, victim advocacy, and correctional facilities, or for further graduate studies. Our faculty are experts in various subfields of criminology, providing students with up-to-date knowledge and diverse perspectives. The program also offers opportunities for internships, giving students practical experience in real-world settings.
ScholarshipAmount: Amounts range from $2,000 to $3,500 per year; some scholarships cover full tuition.

Description: The Bachelor of Science (B.S.) in Sociology with a concentration in Social Justice provides students with a strong theoretical and methodological foundation in the study of society, with a particular emphasis on understanding and addressing social inequality, human rights, and advocacy. This concentration prepares students for careers in social justice organizations, community activism, public policy, and further graduate study in sociology, law, social work, and related fields. Students will develop critical thinking, research, and communication skills essential for analyzing complex social problems and advocating for positive social change.

CostPerCredit: In-state: ~$416/hour; Out-of-state: ~$1,259/hour (based on 2023-24 rates including fees)

Description: Speech-Language Pathology and Audiology is an academic discipline focused on the study of normal and disordered human communication. This includes articulation, voice, fluency, language, swallowing, and hearing. Speech-language pathologists and audiologists provide services for the prevention, identification, evaluation, and treatment of speech, language, swallowing, and hearing disorders. Both professions require a master's or doctoral degree after the bachelor's degree to practice professionally. A bachelor's degree in Speech-Language Pathology and Audiology is an excellent preparatory degree for graduate study in speech-language pathology and audiology, as well as related fields. The curriculum for the B.S. degree provides the foundational knowledge necessary for graduate work in these professions. Graduates with a bachelor's degree are also prepared to work as paraprofessionals in a variety of settings (e.g., speech-language pathology assistants, audiology assistants, teachers of the deaf or hard of hearing).

Concentration: Acting, Design, Directing, Theatre Education, Stage Management
Description: The Theatre Program at MTSU emphasizes the liberal arts and trains students for a variety of futures in professional theatre, educational theatre, and graduate school. The program provides students with broad-based theatre education with opportunities for specialization within the curriculum. Students gain practical experience through active participation in productions and work with faculty who are active professionals, artists, and scholars. Our commitment to high quality, diverse programming, and experiential learning ensures that our students are well prepared for the future.

The Theatre-Teacher Licensure Concentration (B.S.) provides students with a broad and in-depth preparation for a teaching career in theatre arts at the secondary school level. It also prepares students for further graduate study in theatre education. Graduates of the program are prepared to teach all areas of theatre arts in middle and high school as well as serve as directors of school theatre productions. The curriculum combines courses in acting, directing, design, theatre history, dramatic literature, and playwriting with courses in education, teaching methods, and student teaching.

ProgramName: Aerospace B.S. (Aerospace Technology, Flight Dispatch and Maintenance Management only)
Concentration: Aerospace Technology, Flight Dispatch, Maintenance Management
Description: The MTSU Aerospace professional pilot degree program has received national and international acclaim as one of the best programs in the country. Our graduates fly for major and regional airlines, cargo companies, military operations, and corporate flight departments. Other graduates find employment in airport management, aerospace technology, aviation management, flight dispatch, maintenance management, and air traffic control. Whether you choose to fly or work on the ground, MTSU Aerospace will prepare you for an exciting and rewarding career in the aerospace industry.
Accredidation: The Maintenance Management concentration is accredited by the Aviation Accreditation Board International (AABI).

Description: The goal of this project is to provide undergraduate students with an experiential learning opportunity that will equip them with the analytical and data science skills necessary to make data-driven decisions in the agricultural sector. The project targets students in underrepresented groups and those who are first-generation college students, rural residents, and military veterans and dependents. Students participating in the program will be known as Agri-Analytics Fellows. Fellows will receive training in analytical tools, decision-making, and communication and professional skills through a short-course series and an internship with an agricultural business or government agency. Faculty from the Department of Agribusiness and Agriscience and the Data Science Institute at Middle Tennessee State University will deliver the short-courses, and faculty from partner institutions will provide additional training. Through this project, fellows will not only expand career pathways but also meet the demand for a highly skilled workforce that is prepared to tackle the challenges of 21st century agriculture.

The Bachelor of Science (B.S.) in Biochemistry at Middle Tennessee State University is designed to give students a comprehensive background in modern biochemistry. This includes a strong foundation in the fundamentals of chemistry and biology, as well as specialized coursework in areas such as enzymology, metabolism, molecular biology, and proteomics. Graduates of the program are well-prepared for careers in biotechnology, pharmaceuticals, research, and healthcare, or for further graduate studies in biochemistry, molecular biology, medicine, or related fields. The program emphasizes hands-on laboratory experience and provides opportunities for undergraduate research.

ProgramName: Biology, Genetics and Biotechnology Concentration, B.S.
Description: MTSU's B.S. in Biology provides a comprehensive curriculum covering cell biology, genetics, ecology, evolution, and more. Students gain a foundational understanding of life sciences, preparing them for diverse careers in research, healthcare, education, and environmental fields.

The B.S. in Biology with Teacher Licensure program allows students to earn a bachelor's degree in Biology while simultaneously earning a teaching license in Secondary Education (grades 6-12). This program, offered in conjunction with the Department of Curriculum and Instruction, requires students to complete 120 credit hours in coursework, including 32 credit hours in Biology and 39 credit hours in education. Many students graduating with this degree will go on to teach biology in middle or high school. The program also serves as excellent preparation for graduate studies or for careers in related fields. Students interested in this program should contact the Biology department as early as possible to plan their curriculum.
CostPerCredit: In-State: $330/credit hour + fees; Out-of-State: $1,131/credit hour + fees

Description: The Department of Chemistry at MTSU offers a Bachelor of Science degree in Chemistry with a concentration certified by the American Chemical Society (ACS). This concentration prepares students for careers in the chemical industry or for graduate study leading to master's or doctoral degrees in chemistry or related fields. The program meets the standards set forth by the ACS Committee on Professional Training, ensuring a rigorous and comprehensive education in the chemical sciences. Our curriculum emphasizes a strong foundation in all major areas of chemistry: analytical, biochemistry, inorganic, organic, and physical chemistry. Students gain hands-on experience through extensive laboratory work and research opportunities with faculty. The program focuses on developing critical thinking, problem-solving, and communication skills essential for success in scientific careers.
Accredidation: The Bachelor of Science in Chemistry with the ACS Certified Concentration is approved by the American Chemical Society (ACS) Committee on Professional Training. This certification signifies that the program meets rigorous national standards for undergraduate chemistry education.

Fees: TN Resident: $7,133/Semester; Non-TN Resident: $14,594/Semester (Based on 9 credit hours for Fall 2023/Spring 2024)
Description: MTSU's Master of Science (M.S.) in Computer Science program offers students the opportunity to conduct research and expand their knowledge in several advanced computer science areas. Students can choose between a thesis and non-thesis option, allowing for flexibility based on their career goals. The thesis option provides an in-depth research experience, ideal for those considering doctoral studies or research-oriented positions. The non-thesis option emphasizes coursework and practical applications, preparing students for immediate roles in industry. Faculty members are active in research, providing students with opportunities to work on cutting-edge projects in areas such as artificial intelligence, machine learning, cybersecurity, data science, and software engineering. The M.S. in Computer Science program is designed to provide students with the advanced knowledge, skills, and research experience necessary for successful careers in industry, government, or academia.
CostPerCredit: TN Resident: $738/credit hour; Non-TN Resident: $1,567/credit hour (for 2023-24, includes mandatory fees per credit hour)
MinimumGreScore: A minimum combined score of 290 on the verbal and quantitative sections and a minimum of 143 on the quantitative section.
ScholarshipAmount: Graduate Assistantship stipends range from $1,111.11 to $1,333.33 per month.
ScholarshipPercentage: Graduate Assistantships provide full tuition coverage.

Fees: In-State: $9,658/year; Out-of-State: $27,418/year (2023-2024, includes tuition and mandatory fees for full-time students)
Description: Data Science is a rapidly emerging field centered on extracting knowledge and insights from structured and unstructured data. Data scientists use skills from statistics, computer science, and specific subject matter areas to analyze data and address complex problems. Our program provides a solid foundation in data science concepts, statistical methods, computational tools, and practical applications, preparing students for careers in this dynamic and growing field. This multidisciplinary degree program integrates coursework from the Departments of Computer Science and Mathematical Sciences and features a practical, hands-on capstone experience.

ProgramName: Engineering Technology, Computer Eng. Tech. B.S.
Description: The Bachelor of Science in Computer Engineering Technology program teaches students to integrate electrical engineering, computer science, and engineering technology to develop, design, test, and implement computer systems in modern applications. The program provides the graduate with the expertise to design, program, and maintain modern computer systems by utilizing the latest hardware and software tools. The curriculum includes areas in digital logic design, embedded systems, microcontrollers, computer architecture, data communication and networking, programming languages, and operating systems. Graduates of the program are able to apply the knowledge and skills necessary for successful careers in industry, research, and development. Typical positions include computer hardware engineer, embedded systems developer, network administrator, and computer systems analyst.
Accredidation: The Computer Engineering Technology program is accredited by the Engineering Technology Accreditation Commission of ABET, https://www.abet.org.

Description: MTSU's Bachelor of Science (B.S.) degree program in Environmental Sustainability and Technology prepares students for careers in the growing green economy. Students learn about environmental and energy systems, policy, and management issues related to energy production and conservation, pollution prevention, and remediation. This program includes a strong technical core with a focus on problem-solving, analytical skills, and hands-on laboratory and field experience through interdisciplinary instruction from faculty in Science, Engineering Technology, and other departments. The program focuses on how technologies can provide solutions to environmental problems and lead to a more sustainable future.

The Master of Science in Geosciences program is designed to provide graduate students with advanced training in the diverse fields of geosciences. Students can choose a thesis or non-thesis option, tailored to their career aspirations. The program emphasizes critical thinking, research methodologies, and hands-on experience, preparing graduates for successful careers in academia, government, and industry. Students in the Geosciences, M.S. program will develop: Advanced understanding of geological processes, Earth systems, and environmental geosciences; Proficiency in data analysis, geospatial technologies, and field investigation techniques; The ability to design and conduct independent research, analyze complex data, and effectively communicate scientific findings; Critical thinking skills to address contemporary environmental and geological challenges.
ScholarshipAmount: $9,000 stipend for the academic year (for graduate assistantships)

Description: The Mathematics, B.S. with a concentration in Advanced Mathematics is designed for students who wish to pursue a graduate degree in Mathematics or a related field, or to work in a position requiring strong mathematical skills. As an Advanced Mathematics concentration student, you will delve deeper into theoretical mathematics. You will master abstract algebra, real analysis, complex analysis, and geometry through a rigorous and comprehensive curriculum, allowing you to develop a robust understanding of advanced mathematical concepts. This program provides an excellent foundation for those interested in graduate studies in mathematics or related fields, such as theoretical physics or computer science, or for those seeking careers in research and development requiring advanced analytical and problem-solving skills.
ScholarshipAmount: Guaranteed scholarships range from $3,000 to $5,000 per year
ScholarshipPercentage: 84.5% of first-time, full-time undergraduate students received grant or scholarship aid in Fall 2023

ProgramName: Mathematics, Statistics and Data Analysis Concentration, B.S.
Concentration: Mathematics, Statistics and Data Analysis Concentration
Description: The Bachelor of Science (B.S.) in Mathematics with a concentration in Statistics and Data Analysis is for students who want to develop strong theoretical knowledge of mathematics, especially as it applies to statistics, data analysis, and mathematical modeling. This program provides students with the critical thinking and problem-solving skills needed to pursue graduate degrees in mathematics, statistics, or data science, or to prepare them for careers in industry or government. Students completing this concentration will be well-prepared to sit for actuarial exams, earn teaching licenses (secondary level), or pursue employment in any field that requires analytical, quantitative, or computational problem-solving skills.

If you're pursuing an undergraduate degree in a field other than Accounting, a minor in Accounting can help you understand the language of business ' finances. No matter what your chosen field of study, an understanding of the balance sheet, income statement and cash flow statement will benefit you. A basic understanding of accounting will assist you in managing your personal finances as well. An Accounting minor will provide you with a foundation in general business, financial accounting, managerial accounting, and accounting systems. For the minor, students must complete at least 15 semester hours in Accounting courses including 6 hours of upper-division courses.

The Agricultural minor provides a pathway for students to learn about modern agriculture. It allows students who may not be pursuing an agricultural degree, but have an interest in agriculture, to have some general coursework to take and apply it to their existing major.

The minor in Anthropology allows students to gain a deeper understanding of human diversity in all its forms. From the evolution of our species and the study of nonhuman primates, to the development of complex societies, the anthropology minor can broaden your knowledge about the human experience. As an interdisciplinary field, Anthropology helps students to develop critical thinking, communication, and analytical skills that are highly valued in any career path. Students will be exposed to all four subfields of Anthropology (Cultural, Biological, Archaeological, and Linguistic) through core coursework and then have the opportunity to specialize through elective courses in areas that interest them. This program pairs well with any major, adding a valuable international and cross-cultural perspective to your degree.

The Business Administration minor at MTSU is for students in degree programs outside of the Jones College of Business. Through the Business Administration minor, students gain a solid foundation in the core principles of business while complementing their major field of study. Upon completion of the minor, students will have a well-rounded understanding of how businesses operate. Required courses: MGT 3610, MKT 3820, FIN 3010 or FIN 3600 (not both), BDA 2610, ECON 2420 or ECON 2410 (not both).

The Business Analytics Minor is designed to provide business students with the knowledge and skills necessary to understand and apply analytical techniques to solve complex business problems. This minor will provide students with the ability to interpret data, create data visualizations, develop statistical models, and apply machine learning algorithms to improve decision making within an organization.
CostPerCredit: In-State: $398 per credit hour; Out-of-State: $1094 per credit hour (2024-25 rates)
ScholarshipAmount: Guaranteed freshman scholarships range from $2,000 to $8,000 per year

Fees: In-State: $4,992/semester; Out-of-State: $15,480/semester (for 2024-2025). A Business Course Fee of $100 per credit hour also applies.
Description: MTSU's Business Law minor offers students a general knowledge of the legal environment in which businesses operate and an understanding of specific substantive areas of the law. The minor focuses on the legal concepts associated with the operation of a business enterprise and provides an overview of legal areas that have become increasingly critical to entrepreneurs and managers. It is especially useful for students interested in attending law school and those seeking positions in business law, human resource management, real estate, and finance. The minor consists of 15 credit hours of required coursework.
CostPerCredit: In-State: $416.50/credit hour; Out-of-State: $1290.50/credit hour (for 2024-2025). An additional $100/credit hour Business Course Fee applies to all business courses.
ScholarshipAmount: $3,500 to $8,000 per year for guaranteed freshman scholarships.

Description: Communication is a fundamental skill essential for success in all aspects of life—personal, professional, and civic. The Communication minor is designed for students from any major who wish to enhance their communication skills, critical thinking, and understanding of human interaction. The curriculum provides students with a broad understanding of communication theories and practices. Students will develop practical skills in areas such as public speaking, interpersonal communication, organizational communication, and intercultural communication. An understanding of communication processes and effective communication strategies is highly valued by employers across various industries. This minor is an excellent complement to any major, providing a valuable skill set that will enhance your career prospects and personal development.

The Criminal Investigation minor provides students with the foundational knowledge and skills necessary to pursue a career as a criminal investigator. This minor offers a comprehensive curriculum that covers various aspects of criminal investigations, including investigative techniques, forensic science principles, evidence collection and preservation, interview and interrogation strategies, and legal considerations. Students will learn about the different stages of an investigation, from initial response to case presentation in court. Through a combination of theoretical knowledge and practical applications, students will develop critical thinking, problem-solving, and analytical skills essential for effective criminal investigation. The minor emphasizes ethical considerations and professionalism in the field, preparing students to uphold justice and contribute to public safety.

The minor in Criminal Justice Administration is designed to provide students with an understanding of the criminal justice system as an area of scholarly study and professional practice. It is particularly relevant for students interested in a career in criminal justice agencies or those whose major field of study would be complemented by such a background.
ScholarshipAmount: Up to full tuition and fees

Description: The Cultural Geography minor allows students to apply a spatial perspective to human activities. You will study population, religions, politics, economic development, and cultural landscapes from a geographic perspective. The minor provides a strong foundation for students interested in careers in city and regional planning, tourism, international business, and intelligence, or for further graduate study in geography. In this minor, students will acquire: (1) skills to understand and analyze spatial patterns and processes, (2) the ability to interpret and create maps, (3) knowledge of cultural phenomena, and (4) the ability to think critically about spatial issues.

ProgramName: Driver and Traffic Safety Education Minor
Description: The Driver and Traffic Safety Education Minor provides students with the academic and practical knowledge required to teach driver education. The curriculum includes courses in driver and traffic safety, methods of teaching driver education, and practical experience in teaching driver education. Graduates of this program are prepared to teach driver education in high schools and other educational settings.

An undergraduate Minor in Economics consists of 18 credit hours and is available to all students except those majoring in Economics and those with a double major in Economics. An undergraduate Minor in Economics provides students with a foundational understanding of economic principles and how they can be applied to real-world situations. It complements a variety of majors by enhancing analytical and critical thinking skills, preparing students for diverse careers in business, finance, government, and law. It demonstrates a commitment to understanding market dynamics, policy impacts, and global economic trends, making graduates more competitive in the job market.
CostPerCredit: In-state: $448.50 per credit hour; Out-of-state: $1201.50 per credit hour

Fees: In-state: $9,934/year; Out-of-state: $31,126/year (based on 15 credits per semester for 2024-2025)
Description: The Economics/Finance minor is designed to provide students with foundational knowledge in economics and finance, which can complement a wide range of majors. The minor emphasizes practical application and critical thinking in areas such as financial markets, economic analysis, and investment principles. Students will develop skills essential for understanding global economic trends, making informed financial decisions, and preparing for careers in business, finance, and related fields.

Fees: $9,872/Year (based on full-time, in-state undergraduate tuition and mandatory fees for 2023-2024)
Description: The Engineering Technology Minor provides students with fundamental knowledge and skills in engineering technology. This minor complements various majors, offering a practical understanding of design, development, and implementation processes in technological systems. Students will engage with topics such as drafting, manufacturing processes, quality assurance, and project management. This minor is ideal for students seeking to broaden their technical expertise and enhance their career opportunities in fields requiring applied engineering skills.

In this minor, students will discover the enduring power of language and literature. Whether through the study of diverse texts, creative writing, or rhetoric and writing, the English minor helps students develop critical thinking and communication skills essential for success in any career path. From analyzing classic works to crafting compelling narratives, students in this program will learn to appreciate the nuances of human expression and hone their abilities to interpret, create, and communicate effectively in a variety of contexts.

An interdisciplinary minor that provides students with a broad understanding of the physical and biological processes that govern the natural world, the role of humans in modifying these processes, and the scientific methods used to analyze and address environmental problems. The minor is flexible, allowing students to tailor their coursework to their interests in natural science, social science, or policy-related issues relevant to the environment.
ScholarshipAmount: Guaranteed scholarships range from $3,500 to $5,000 per year

Description: The Finance Minor is intended for students who desire to broaden their knowledge in finance, but who are not finance majors. The Finance Minor will provide students with the basic knowledge of financial markets and financial management. Students will learn how to make wise decisions regarding individual and corporate assets through an understanding of financial statements, time value of money, capital markets, and financial institutions. A minor in Finance will benefit students pursuing a variety of majors by adding a practical understanding of money and financial decision-making in personal and professional contexts.
Accredidation: Jennings A. Jones College of Business, which houses the Economics and Finance Department, is accredited by AACSB International - The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business.

Description: The Healthcare Administration Minor provides students with knowledge and skills for entry-level administrative positions in a variety of healthcare settings. This minor is open to all students at MTSU. Students desiring to declare a minor in Healthcare Administration should contact the Department of Health and Human Performance for additional advising information.
ScholarshipAmount: Up to $5,000/year for guaranteed freshman scholarships

Description: A minor in History consists of 18 semester hours of History courses. No more than 6 semester hours of credit may be transferred from another institution. No more than 3 semester hours of History credit may be earned by special examination or by portfolio. No more than 6 semester hours may be 1000-level courses. A grade of C- or better is required in all courses counted toward the minor. The minor can be earned either through the traditional face-to-face classroom setting or entirely online.
CostPerCredit: $327/credit hour (In-State undergraduate maintenance fee for 2023-24, additional fees apply)

Description: The Homeland Security Minor is an interdisciplinary program designed to prepare students for careers in homeland security and related fields. It provides a broad overview of the various threats facing the nation, as well as the strategies and policies in place to address them. The minor emphasizes critical thinking, problem-solving, and ethical decision-making, equipping students with the knowledge and skills necessary to contribute to the safety and security of communities at local, state, and national levels.

The Human Sciences minor provides students with the opportunity to gain fundamental knowledge in subject matter that supports the human condition. The minor is offered to provide students with a general background in fields related to human needs, such as individuals, families, and communities. Students will gain knowledge related to family and consumer sciences, nutrition, housing, textiles, and human development.
ScholarshipAmount: Up to $6,000 per year for guaranteed scholarships

Description: Information systems are the foundation of business, and an information systems minor can provide students with knowledge and skills to understand the role of information systems within an organization. Students will explore how information systems are used to solve business problems, how they are managed, and how they contribute to an organization's overall success. Courses cover topics such as database management, business intelligence, systems analysis and design, and cybersecurity.

The minor in Journalism will expose students to skills in reporting, writing, editing, and ethics that will prepare them for a variety of careers in the media industry. Students will study the history of journalism and its role in society, and learn best practices for gathering, evaluating, and presenting information. The minor will complement any major, helping students develop critical thinking and communication skills essential for success in today's complex world.
ScholarshipAmount: Amounts for guaranteed scholarships range from $2,000 to $8,000 per year.

Fees: In-state: $10,114/year; Out-of-state: $29,578/year (based on 12+ credit hours per semester for Fall 2024-Spring 2025)
Description: The Leisure & Sport Management (LSM) minor is designed to develop knowledge and skills to provide for a wide variety of recreation, sport, leisure, and entertainment opportunities within diverse sectors of the leisure industry. This minor will expand students' understanding of the field and prepare them for employment or graduate study in areas such as: community recreation, sport and athletics, outdoor recreation, event management, resort and commercial recreation, youth-serving organizations, tourism, campus recreation, and military recreation. The minor is flexible, allowing students to tailor course selection to meet their individual interests and career goals. Because of the growing interest in health and well-being, the leisure and sport industry continues to expand as individuals and groups seek positive leisure experiences.
CostPerCredit: In-state: $565/credit hour; Out-of-state: $1,341/credit hour (based on Fall 2024-Spring 2025 non-guaranteed rates)
ScholarshipAmount: Up to $6,000 per year for guaranteed freshman scholarships

Fees: In-State: $9,988/year; Out-of-State: $29,956/year (based on 2024-2025 rates for full-time undergraduates)
Description: The minor in Management is for students desiring an understanding of management concepts related to the business, private, or public sectors. Students will learn how organizations function, how managers motivate people, how to manage human resources, how to develop strategies to compete, and how to operate effectively and efficiently in a global economy. It is a good choice for those who are in a non-business major or those who wish to complement a business major.
CostPerCredit: In-State: $413/credit hour; Out-of-State: $1,245/credit hour (based on 2024-2025 rates)
ScholarshipPercentage: 86% of beginning full-time freshmen receive grants or scholarships

Description: A minor in Marketing can be a valuable addition to your academic portfolio regardless of your major. The minor provides a basic understanding of marketing principles and is an excellent complement to many majors such as Entrepreneurship, Professional Selling, Business Administration, Computer Information Systems, Fashion Merchandising, Graphic Design, Communication Studies, and Journalism, to name a few. Marketing courses will equip you with knowledge and skills relevant to various careers, including advertising, brand management, digital marketing, market research, and sales. It can also serve as a foundational step toward pursuing a master's degree in marketing or an MBA. The Department of Marketing offers a diverse selection of courses, allowing you to tailor your minor to align with your interests and career goals. Some of these course topics include digital marketing, advertising, international marketing, and social media marketing. The Marketing minor is open to all majors except Marketing majors (who already get more marketing content than the minor offers). To earn a minor in Marketing, you must complete 18 semester hours (6 courses) of Marketing (MKT) courses with at least 9 of the 18 hours completed at MTSU. Students must earn a grade of “C-” or better in all courses taken to complete the minor.
CostPerCredit: $441.50 per credit hour for in-state undergraduates (Fall 2024 rate)

Description: A minor in Mass Communication will complement most any major at MTSU. If you desire to develop a broad understanding of the role and influence of mass media in society, along with basic skills to produce content or tell stories, then this minor is for you. This minor is comprised of 18 credit hours and can be combined with any major outside of the College of Media and Entertainment. If you are majoring in a program within the College of Media and Entertainment, you should seek advisement regarding the courses you may take to satisfy requirements of the minor.

The Nutrition and Food Science minor at MTSU provides students with a foundational understanding of nutrition principles and food science concepts. This minor is an excellent complement to a variety of majors, including those in health sciences, exercise science, biology, chemistry, and hospitality. Students will learn about human nutrition, food preparation, food safety, and the role of food in health and disease. The curriculum emphasizes both the scientific aspects of food and nutrition and their practical applications. This minor is designed to enhance students' career readiness in fields related to health, wellness, food industry, and consumer education.

A minor in political science requires 15 credit hours of Political Science (POS) courses. The minor will provide students with a basic understanding of government and politics in the United States and around the world, as well as the major subfields of political science. It is an excellent complement to several majors at MTSU, including Criminal Justice Administration, Economics, History, Global Studies, and Social Work.
ScholarshipAmount: $2,000 - $6,000 per year; Full-tuition scholarships also available

Description: Our Professional Selling Certificate program is a non-credit executive education program offered to the general public, designed to help individuals acquire the skills and confidence necessary to excel in a dynamic sales environment. Whether you are new to sales, a seasoned professional looking to refine your techniques, or an entrepreneur aiming to boost your business, this certificate will equip you with practical strategies and insights for immediate impact. Our program blends theoretical knowledge with real-world applications, ensuring a comprehensive learning experience. In this program, participants will gain an understanding of: The fundamentals of the sales process, including prospecting, lead generation, and client relationship management. Effective communication and negotiation strategies tailored for sales interactions. How to identify customer needs and present solutions that resonate. Building long-term client relationships and fostering customer loyalty. Utilizing technology and data analytics to enhance sales performance. Ethical considerations and professional conduct in sales.

Fees: In-State: $5,052/Semester, Out-of-State: $14,796/Semester (for full-time undergraduates, Fall 2024 - Spring 2025)
Description: By adding a Psychology minor, students gain valuable knowledge about human behavior, cognition, and emotion that can complement any major. This minor enhances critical thinking, research skills, and an understanding of psychological principles, making graduates more versatile and appealing to a wide range of employers or for further academic pursuits.
CostPerCredit: In-State: $421/credit hour, Out-of-State: $1,233/credit hour (for undergraduates, Fall 2024 - Spring 2025)

Description: Public Health is the science and art of preventing disease, prolonging life and promoting health through the organized efforts and informed choices of society, organizations, public and private communities and individuals. Public health addresses human health at the population level, and a minor in Public Health complements any major because every career field directly or indirectly impacts the health of its workers, clients, or communities.
CostPerCredit: $438 per credit hour (in-state); $1,280 per credit hour (out-of-state)
ScholarshipAmount: Varies, with guaranteed freshman awards ranging from $2,000 to $6,000 per year.

Description: The Public Relations minor requires 18 hours. These hours include three core classes plus three additional classes from a list of approved courses. The PR minor provides students with a solid foundation in the concepts and practices of public relations, preparing them for a variety of entry-level positions in the field. Students learn to research, plan, implement, and evaluate public relations campaigns, as well as develop strong written and oral communication skills.

The Medieval Studies minor introduces students to the culture, history, and literature of medieval Europe (c. 500-1500 C.E.). Students will gain familiarity with the period through a series of core courses and electives, developing a deeper understanding of the foundations of Western civilization. Medieval Studies combines the traditional disciplines of history and English with art, philosophy, religious studies, and foreign languages. Students pursuing the minor will encounter the history, thought, culture, and literature of this fascinating period and learn more about the Middle Ages in Europe and beyond.

The Department of Theatre and Dance offers a minor in Musical Theatre Performance.
